Keila has two years of experience in the clothing sales business. She decided to work in the business by her own initiative, since the first idea that she had was to establish a beauty salon, but she didn't have enough capital and she decided to start selling clothing. The business has been growing bit by bit. She travels from her house to work every day at 7 in the morning, since the business is 10 kilometers from her house and she comes back at 4 in the afternoon.

The loan the Keila is requesting is to purchase clothing for her business and to pay for a new, larger, retail space that she is renting in the municipal market.

Keila's dreams are to begin to fix up the new retail space that is being rented to her. In addition, she dreams of establishing her beauty salon, which is her primary objective, and expand the clothing business that she has. In addition, she wants to get married and have her own family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for her business and to pay for a new, larger, retail space that she is renting in the municipal market.

loans.name: Shantana

texts.en:
Shantana is a 37-year-old woman who has two children (one son and one daughter). She lives in the village of Sarada Pally in the district of Alipurduar. Santana's husband is engaged in animal husbandry. Her son and daughter are both students. They are at village schools. 

Shantana and her husband rear cows and sell cow milk to their villagers. There has been increased demand for milk in the market, which is pushing Shantana to buy another dairy cow.

So Shantana decided to take a loan from Kiva lenders via BJS to purchase a dairy cow. An extra cow will provide her with a lot of reasonable profit. She will be able to produce more milk and increase her sales volume. 

Shantana gives heartiest thanks to Kiva and BJS for making their future secure.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her business.

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул, 29 лет, замужем, есть ребенок. По характеру очень веселая, общительная и трудолюбивая девушка. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Нургул 4 года назад начала заниматься торговлей мужской одеждой. На сегодня в обороте есть товар на 250,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Нургул, ее деятельность приносит прибыль около 23,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одежды для расширения ассортимента. Доходы Нургул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Nurgul is 29 years old, and married with a child. She is a very happy, sociable and hard-working woman. 4 years ago, as a source of income for her family, Nurgul started selling men's clothing. Today, she has goods that are worth 250,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nurgul's persistent hard work, her activities bring in a profit of around 23,000 som (KGS). She turned to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy clothes to increase her assortment. With the income, Nurgul plans to invest in the further expansion of the business, and in improving her housing.

loans.use: To buy men's clothes for sale in order to increase assortment in her shop.

loans.name: Niyati

texts.en:
37-year-old Niyati is a rural woman from a small village in Falakata. She has a family of four. Her husband Kamal is a farmer and she takes care of her own animal husbandry. One of her children is a student and other is involved in small income-generating work.

Niyati rears dairy cows and sells milk in her local area and to neighbors. She helps her husband to earn their livelihood. Together the couple’s income is not enough to meet the family’s household expenses. So Niyati wants to buy a new dairy cow so she can sell more milk so that the family income will increase. This is why she requested a loan to Kiva’s partner, BJS. 

She hopes the profit generated from the business will increase and improve her family's finances. She dreams of building a concrete house with this profit.

Niyati conveys her gratitude to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a rural housewife aged 32. She lives with her husband and two sons in a small village named Raychanga in Alipurduar district of West Bengal, India. Both of her sons are students now.

Kalpana's husband has been running a small grocery shop selling items like soap, shampoo, washing powder, sugar, tea, oil, lentils, eggs, etc. for many years. Kalpana also helps her husband in this business in addition to managing her household work. They started the business with a small investment of their own. With their small income, it is very difficult to provide the family with the daily basic needs as well as cover the children’s education costs.

So to expand their business for some more income, Kalpana has decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She will use the loan to purchase more grocery items for their grocery store. She hopes that this investment will give them more income; she will be able to provide sufficient financial sustenance to her family and give a better education to the children.

She wants to build a concrete house for her family in the future with her savings.

She will be grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Sandhya

texts.en:
Sandhya lives in Alipurduar in West Bengal. She is a 32-year-old married lady. Together with her husband, she is raising two young sons, of whom one is a student in grade 1, the other is a toddler. Sandhya and her husband jointly manage a business manufacturing bags (school bags, ladies bags, purses, wallets, travel bags etc.) which is the only source of income for the family.

In spite of their tireless work, they are unable to provide the family with a decent lifestyle and to cover all the expenses. So Sandhya has decided to invest more on their business to get a better income. Self-confident and enterprising, Sandhya knows that there is a great demand for her products (bags) in the market.

She is determined to succeed despite the many challenges, and the greatest of them is lack of capital to expand their business. So she has asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to overcome the problems. She wants to purchase more raw materials for their business such as leather, cloth, gum, handles, buttons and other necessary items for the development of her business.

She thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her bag manufacturing business.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín, desarrolla el cultivo de granos básicos y elaboración de jarcia, es casado, vive con su familia compuesta por su esposa y cuatro hijos, tres de ellos están estudiando y el mayor le apoya con las actividades de agricultura, el oficio lo ha desarrollado de toda su vida y lo aprendió con la ayuda de su padre, hoy en día se lo está enseñando a sus hijos, desempeñando estás actividades ha podido sostener a su familia.
Requiere de un crédito para comprar insecticidas, abono y semilla para ir preparando el terreno en el que siembra, además pagara el arrendamiento del mismo, su objetivo es tener todo a su disposición para cuando inicie la temporada indicada para sembrar y de esta manera continuar trabajando y progresando.
Sus sueños son continuar trabajando para mantener en actividad su negocio pues es así como puede ir mejorando las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Efrain cultivates basic grains and also produces agave. He is married and lives with his wife and four children, three of whom are in school while the eldest helps with the agricultural work.

Efrain has done this work all his life, he learned with the help of his father, and nowadays he is teaching the same to his children. It is through this work that he has been able to support the family.

He is applying for a loan to buy insecticides, compost and seeds to prepare the land for planting, as well as to pay the rent for the use of the land. He is looking to have everything at hand for the start of the planting season, so that he can continue working and make progress.

Efrain's dream is to continue working in order to keep the business going, this being how he can improve the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, compost, and seeds to prepare the land that he farms, as well as to pay the rent for it.

loans.name: Maria Nery

texts.es:
La señora María de  47  años de edad  es  madre soltera y vive en su casa de habitación con sus hijos, tiene un negocio el cual es la elaboración y venta de alfarería, donde elabora lo que son  jarros, joyeros, gallos de barro, plato, picheles y una gran variedad en adornos, es conocida  por ser una persona luchadora con el deseo de seguir adelante.
Doña María necesita el préstamo para la compra de pinceles, pintura, barro, etc. espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante en su negocio y obtener las ganancias necesarias para salir adelante con su familia en el hogar.
Uno de sus  sueños es  terminar de construir un local para su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras  - Mayo del 2015
texts.en:
María, 47, is a single mother who lives in her home with her children.  She has a business making and selling pottery: pitchers, jewelry boxes, clay roosters, plates, jugs, and a wide variety of decorations.  She's known as a persevering person with a desire to get ahead.

María needs the loan to buy brushes, paint, clay, etc.  She hopes this investment will allow her to get ahead in her business and earn the money she needs to get ahead with her family in her household.

One of her dreams is to finish building a space for her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, May 2015

loans.use: to buy brushes, paint, clay, etc. for her business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Hilda is 42 years old and has three children are presently in school.

Hilda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Hilda has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn works hard to support her family. She is married with two children and has a broom making business in the Philippines.

Jonalyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional raw material for her business.

Jonalyn has been in this business for three years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw material for her broom making business

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rodelyn is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rodelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Rodelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Judy is 46 years old and has two children are still in school.

Judy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fish to sell.

Judy has been in this business for 16 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Hamami

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Hamami, one of Ruma’s agents. Hamami lives in Cilegon, Banten, located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married. Together with his wife, they have three children. 

Hamami sells mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services for his community. He joined Ruma almost a year ago. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall. Hamami is a kind and hardworking person. His community sees him as a trusted and informative mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Hamami is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Hamami improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. 

Hamami's goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community, with Ruma's latest product, called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Hamami is the one who is standing. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of his local community.

loans.name: Zarzamora Group

texts.es:
Existe una comunidad del Estado de México en donde se preserva la cultura y lengua mazahua. Los habitantes son famosos por tener un trato amable con cualquier visitante además de tener muy arraigadas sus fiestas y tradiciones. La actividad económica que sobresale es la agricultura y la cría de animales de corral. 
   Doña Hilaria es una mujer reservada, pero también llena de energía y amabilidad. Está casada desde hace veintitrés años con el señor Gregorio quien trabaja en la construcción, la pareja formó una familia con seis hijos de los cuales tres aun dependen de ellos.
   Hace nueve años, Hilaria escuchó hablar de VisionFund y decidió solicitar su primer préstamo para la cría y engorda de borregos pues tiene veinte años de experiencia en esta actividad. En la comunidad es muy común criar ovinos ya que difícilmente llegan a enfermar y el alimento se aprovecha de la gran extensión de campo. Desde muy temprano, Hilaria se levanta a trabajar, barre el espacio de sus animales, a mediodía los saca a pastar al campo mientras ella aprovecha el tiempo para hacer la limpieza de su casa. Una vez que el sol comienza a ponerse, nuevamente los lleva de regreso a su corral. A Doña Hilaria le encanta su trabajo porque desde pequeña se involucró junto con sus padres a realizarlo. Las ganancias le ayudan a solventar los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus niños, pero ahora necesita invertir en animales pequeños para seguir criando y para ello ha solicitado un nuevo préstamo que le permitirá continuar con su actividad. 
   Juan, Raúl, y Julia,  los demás miembros del grupo, también se dedican a la cría de borregos. Todos ellos tienen una amplia experiencia cuidando animales y saben que la mejor época en ventas llegará pronto con las fiestas y celebraciones de fin de año por lo que es momento de comenzar a prepararse y comprar animales para que estén listos en los últimos meses del año. El grupo agradece a VisionFund y a KIVA por la ayuda para mejorar sus negocios y su calidad de vida. 

*La fotografía se tomó en el jardín del municipio, Doña Hilaria es quien viste la falda rosa*
texts.en:
There's a community in the state of Mexico that preserves the Mazahua language and culture.  The residents are famous for their friendly treatment of visitors as well as for their deeply rooted festivals and traditions.  The main economic activity is agriculture and raising small animals.

Hilaria's a very reserved woman, but also full of energy and courtesy.  She has been married for 23 years to Gregorio, who works in construction.  The couple had a family of six children, three of whom are still dependent.

Hilaria heard of VisionFund nine years ago and decided to request her first loan to raise and fatten sheep, because she had 20 years of experience in that line of work.  In the community it's very common to raise sheep because they don't get sick easily and their food comes from the wide expanse of fields.  Hilaria rises very early for work, sweeps her animals' corral, and takes them out to graze in the field at noon while she makes the most of the time to clean her house.  Once the sun starts to set she returns the sheep to their corral.

Hilaria loves her work because she did it with her parents from a very young age.  Her earnings help pay for the household expenses and her children's education.  But now she needs to invest in small animals to keep working, so she requested a new loan.

The other members of the group, Juan, Raúl, and Julia, also earn a living raising sheep.  They all have wide experience taking care of animals and they know the best season for sales is coming soon with the end-of-year festivals and celebrations, so now is the time to start getting ready and buying animals to be ready in the last months of the year.  The group is grateful to VisionFund and Kiva for their help in improving their businesses and quality of life.

The photograph was taken in the town square.  Hilaria's wearing a pink skirt.

loans.use: to buy sheep

location.town: San Miguel La Labor, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 40 years a resident of Kabaseke Kyotera in Rakai district, married with 7 children who all attend school. 
She carries out a business of charcoal selling which she started in 2011.
She works the 7 days of the week and 12 hours per day and she started this business with the aim of increasing her daily income to adequately meet her family financial obligations.

 Ruth wants a loan of 500,000/= to buy more stock for her business. She sales to people in her neighborhood.  Much as she has ready market for the charcoal,her challenges are lack of enough capital to meet the demand, expand the business and competition.
Ruth is a hard working lady.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for sale, to meet demand and also expand her business

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 32 years old, married, and has two children, who are currently in school. Genalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Genalyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. 

Genalyn requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as milk, canned goods, sugar, drinks, spices, noodles, coffee, cooking oil, bread, etc.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as milk, canned goods, sugar, drinks, spices, noodles, coffee, cooking oil, bread, etc

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel, de 64 años de edad, nunca fue a la escuela, está casado y vive con sus 2 hijas y su esposa quien se dedica a la venta de enchiladas, mientras que una de sus hijas se dedica a ayudarle a la madre.

Miguel, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura desde su infancia, cuando su padre lo indujo a los trabajos de la agricultura, tiene una parcela cerca de su casa, él trabaja todos los días por las tardes, ya que en la mañana trabaja con una empresa fumigadora.

Miguel, necesita el dinero para comprar abono e insecticidas para sus cultivos, ya que con un buen mantenimiento la producción será muy buena y eso significa mejores ingresos.

Miguel, sueña con poder algún día comprar otra parcela más para cultivar aún más, ya que su pasión es trabajar la tierra.
texts.en:
Miguel is 64 years old and never went to school. He is married and lives with his 2 daughters and his wife, who sells enchiladas. One of their daughters works helping her mother.

Miguel has worked in agriculture since his childhood, when his father induced him to work in agriculture. He has a plot close to his house. He works every evening because in the morning he works with a fumigating company.  

Miguel needs the money to buy manure and insecticide for his crops because with proper maintenance the production will be very good and that means better income.

Miguel's dream is to be able to buy one more plot one day to farm even more because his passion is working the land.

loans.use: to buy manure and insecticide for his crops.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 31 year old single man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He has a business of growing food crops like Irish potatoes and at the same time does motorcycle transport that adds him more income. 

He faces hardships of seasonal changes, that hinder progress of his farming resulting into low yields and profits. However, he has hopes of constructing a permanent house. Edward has asked for a loan to buy Irish potatoes and till land for farming.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes and till the land for farming.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
The person in the photo is lydia, thirty two years old and a mother of one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from enterprise development and financial management.

She is taking a loan to add more stock of shoes in her shoe selling enterprise. She looks forward to a rise in sales that will enable her get more income. She anticipates using the income in catering for family needs.
Lydia is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of shoes to help boost sales thus more income to meet family needs.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza lives in Loon, Bohol. She engages in a fish-vending business. She sells fresh fish like bolinao (anchovy) and kitong (rabbit) fish. Her husband is a  fisherman. Aiza sells her husband's catch to the locals in her place. She is married and has a 1-year-old child. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing net, floater and rope. These would provide a higher yield and enable her to sell more fish.  Aiza's earnings will improve and she will be able to settle her obligations. She could provide proper nourishment for her child and be able to handle her finances as well.

Aiza is doing her best to expand her fishing livelihood to be successful and able to improve their status of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, floater and rope.

loans.name: Eber

texts.es:
Eber tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Querocotillo, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 8 años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor. Cuenta con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de semillas y pago de mano de obra a jornaleros para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de maíz, esto le permitirá incrementar sus ventas y por ende su nivel de ingresos, lo que le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Eber is 29 years old and lives together with his wife and children in the Querocotillo district, a community that works in agriculture, trade, and raising livestock. The community is located in the Cutervo province that belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru. 

He works in agriculture, especially farming corn. He has been doing this for 8 years, and his wife supports him in this work.  He has regular customers who provide very good personal and work references about him. 

He has requested a loan for the purchase of seeds and to pay for day laborers to maintain his corn crop. This will allow him to increase his sales and consequently his level of income, which is going to allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and pay day laborers to maintain his corn crop.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is married and has one child.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Amalia works hard to support her family. She has been in this business for five years now.

Amalia requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie, 38, is a married woman with two children who are both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ana Marie has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Ana Marie requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, meat, flour, sugar, cooking oil, utensils and other materials.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, meat, flour, sugar, cooking oil, utensils and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Leziel

texts.en:
Leziel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 35 years old, and her three children are currently in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing nets, strings, and gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Leziel has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, strings, and gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza es una mujer de 43 años de edad, una persona muy madura, trabajadora y comprometida con su familia que se dedica a la crianza de marranos, empezó en el año 2012 el negocio por necesidad económica impulsada por el deseo de salir adelante y generar recursos que sirvieran para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Esperanza empezó todo este cuento de ser emprendedora, al principio un poco difícil porque el negocio no daba rentabilidad, pero se sostuvo, creyó en su empresa y hoy en día le va bien, paga sus cuentas y tiene buenas posibilidades de ampliación.

Como la venta de cerdos no era suficiente, Esperanza decidió vender carne, ella misma se encarga de prepararla, sale a entregar los pedidos, es muy poli funcional y activo.

Ella vive junto con su pareja, tiene hijos los cuales le ayudan cuando pueden pero quiere emplear uno, entrenarlo y convertirlo en el heredero de su negocio.

En vista de mejorar las ventas, de aumentar clientes, de ganar una mejor utilidad, esperanzada quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cuido de cerdo, ella solo los alimenta con esto, son cerdos gordos y de una excelente calidad.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a 43-year-old woman. She is mature, hardworking and committed to her family. She raises pigs. She started this business in 2012 due to economic needs and the will to get ahead and generate resources that could help her improve her family’s quality of life.

Esperanza started to get involved in the entrepreneurial world. It was difficult in the beginning because her business was not profitable. However, she kept it afloat. She believed in her business and is currently doing very well. She can pay her debts and has opportunities to grow.

Seeing that the pigs business was not enough, she started to sell meat. She prepares it and delivers the orders herself. She is polyfunctional and energetic. She lives with her partner. Her children help her when they can, but she wants that one of them works full time and learns about the business in order to inherit it from her.

Thinking of improving her sales, attracting more customers, and improving her profits makes her feel positive, so she is requesting a loan to buy concentrate feed for her pigs. This is the only thing she gives them. Her pigs are fat and of good quality.

loans.use: to buy concentrate feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a buy and sell bread business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bread to sell.

Rosenda has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell

loans.name: Ma. Remedios

texts.en:
Ma. Remedios is 48 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, spices, etc.

Ma. Remedios has been in this business for eight years.  She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, spices, etc

loans.name: Sandra Emilena

texts.es:
Sandra, con 42 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 4 hijos. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, un visionaria y buena negociante. 
Siempre ha trabajado como comerciante, vendiendo productos de uso personal a través de catalogo en el municipio de Bello y, desde hace unos meses tiene su propio negocio.  

Ha sabido superar tiempos difíciles en el comercio y sueña con comprarse su casa propia y tener un negocio que perdure en el tiempo; es por ello que Sandra acudió a solicitar un préstamo, el cual utilizará para comprar surtido e inventario de paquetes promocionales de productos de uso personal como desodorantes y cremas. 
Sandra es una mujer muy organizada aunque ha tenido que enfrentar la competencia comercial del sector.  
La suma de todos sus esfuerzos le brindan a toda su familia una calidad de vida excelente.
texts.en:
Sandra, forty-two, is single and the mother of four children. She is a very responsible, hard-working woman, a visionary and good businesswoman. 
She has always worked in sales, selling personal products through a catalog in the municipality of Bello, and she launched her own business a few months ago. 
She has known how to weather challenging periods in sales, and she dreams of buying her own house and having a business that will endure the test of time. That is why she is soliciting a loan, which she will use to buy stock and inventory of promotional packets for personal products like deodorants and creams. 
Sandra is very well-organized, although she has had to deal with competition in this sales sector. 
The sum total of all her hard work lets her family have an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock and inventory of promotional packets for personal products like deodorants and creams

loans.name: Wendi Witu Shg Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Esther; twenty nine years old, married and a mother of three children.
She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2013 to benefit from training on enterprise and financial management. She operates a shop selling commodities like sugar, salt, soap and other household items; she also offers money transfer services (M pesa).

She is borrowing from Kiva to add stock of sugar, salt, soap and other household items in her shop and she hopes this will enable increase her income and improve her living standards.
Esther is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugar, salt, soap and household items to help boost income.

loans.name: Anrie

texts.en:
Anrie is 42 years old and married. Anrie works very hard to provide for her family.

Anrie runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for nine years. 

Anrie requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Evis

texts.en:
Evis is married and has three children. She works hard to support her family. 

Evis has a coco sugar making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now.

Evis requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her coco sugar making business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for her coco sugar making business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. She is married with five children and has a buy-and-sell vegetables and spices business in the Philippines.

Marilou requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of onions, garlic, sugar, salt, pepper and etc. to sell in her food stall.

Marilou has been in this business for 15 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of onions, garlic, sugar, salt, pepper and etc. to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jonabell

texts.en:
Jonabell works hard to support her family. Jonabell is single with two children and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Jonabell requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials like fishnet, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business.

Jonabell has been in this business for six years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials like fishnet, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 48 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Amalia works very hard to provide for them.

Amalia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal care products and other groceries.

Amalia has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Amalia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 41 years old and married with four children, three of whom are currently in school.

Mila is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mila requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mila has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Eni

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Eni, one of Ruma’s agents. Eni lives in Cilegon, Banten, located about a two-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She is happily married. Together with her husband, she has two children. 

Eni sells mobile airtime credits and provides mobile payment services for her community. She joined Ruma almost a year ago. She knew Ruma from a Ruma sales executive who came to her house. Eni is a kind and cheerful person and her community sees her as a trusted and friendly mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Eni is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to her community. Your loan will be very useful to help Eni improve her business and accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc.) for members of her local community.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel lives in Loon, Bohol. She is 31 years of age and has three dependents, age 13, 11 and 8 years old. 

For almost eight years now, she has been an Avon dealer. She earns a living by selling Avon products like body spray, lotion, beauty soap, fashion accessories and many others.  

She has requested a loan in the amount of 6,000 PHP to buy Avon products like cologne, soap, ladies' apparel and accessories. With these, she will be able to cater the orders of her customers. She could also invest her capital into any possible business ventures to augment her income. Thus, Annabel could provide the needs of her growing children and be able to continue to send them to school.

She dreams that someday her small business will become successful and will help them to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Debelyn

texts.en:
Debelyn is 33 years old, married, and has two children, who are in school, Debelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Debelyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.  

Debelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Elvicia

texts.en:
Elvicia is 50 years old, married, and has eleven children, one of whom is still in school.

Elvicia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elvicia has been in this business for four years now, and she has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Elvicia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Gretta

texts.en:
Gretta is 38 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Gretta works very hard to provide for them.

Gretta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, spices, etc.

Gretta has been in this business for seven years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, spices, etc.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of surplus tires business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy surplus tires to sell for her surplus tires business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy surplus tires to sell

loans.name: Renee

texts.en:
Renee is 34 years old and married with three children. With all three children currently in school, Renee works very hard to provide for them.

Renee runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, spices, drinks, canned goods and etc.

Renee has been in this business for two years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, spices, drinks, canned goods and etc

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 34 years old and has four children. With three of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, condiments, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Elsa has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, condiments, canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a personal collection business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional personal care products to sell to her customers.

Jesusa has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional personal care products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Dokturkan

texts.ru: Доктуркан, 63 года, замужем, 4 детей, одна дочь живет с родителями. У Доктуркан - среднее образование, сейчас на пенсии, она знает, как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Доктуркан занимается животноводством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы и 18 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Доктуркан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 бычка для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Доктуркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса и хочет накопить средства на покупку автомобиля для ее сына.
texts.en:
Dokturkan is 63 and married with four children. One daughter still lives with her parents. She has a high school education and is now retired. She knows how to correctly use financial resources and follow a budget to achieve specific goals. Dokturkan works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, and currently has three cows and 18 sheep on her farm with a monthly income of about 16,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, she has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 KGS to purchase a steer for fattening and resale. She plans to put profits from the loan into further expanding her business and wants to save toward buying a car for her son.

loans.use: to buy a steer for fattening and resale

loans.name: Faridhatul

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Faridhatul, one of Ruma’s agents. Faridhatul lives in North Tangerang, a suburban area located about two hours' drive from Jakarta. She is happily married.

Faridhatul owns a stall that sells snacks and mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services for her community. She has been a member of Ruma for almost a year. She knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive, who came to her stall. Faridhatul is a cheerful person, and her community sees her as a trusted and informative mobile provider.

As the business grows, Faridhatul is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to her community. Now that you know about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Faridhatul improve her business and, accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Faridhatul is the one who is smiling. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits and providing bill payment services.

loans.name: Rudiana

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Rudiana, one of Ruma’s agents. Rudiana lives in East Bandung, located in West Java, about three hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married, and together with his wife, he has one cute son. 

He owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services for his community. He already joined Ruma almost a year ago. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall. 

As the business grows, Rudiana is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Rudiana improve his business, and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Rudiana is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits and providing bill payment services

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 58 years old and widowed with five children.

She runs an agricultural business by farming rice in the Philippines. Noemi is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Noemi has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Bernardo Antonio

texts.es:
Bernardo es una persona madura, honesta, trabajadora, humilde y sencilla de 56 años de edad, vive con su pareja, vive por uno de los momentos más lindos de su vida pues hace meses llego una alegría que ha estado buscando durante mucho tiempo, su hijo esa persona que le ha dado alegría, un aire distinto a su hogar, tiene una razón para progresar, sacar su negocio de taberna adelante, todo por darle a ese muchacho una excelente calidad de vida.

Bernardo ahora sueña, con tener una casa propia, antes se conformaba con lo que tenia, pero se quiere ver viviendo en un caluroso y propio hogar junto a su pareja e hijo y trabaja muy duro para poder cumplir este sueño.

Bernardo para mejorar su negocio necesita invertir en él, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de bebidas alcohólicas, como aguardiente, ron, whisky, tequila, cerveza, también compra de café y refrescos.
texts.en:
Bernardo is a honest, hard-working, humble and simple 56 year old man. He lives with his partner. 

Bernardo is living one of the most wonderful moments of his life, a few months ago joy arrived into his life after a long wait, his son was born! His son has bought much happiness into his life and changed the atmosphere of his home. Bernardo now has a reason to progress, to develop his Tavern, to give everything to give his child the best possible life. 

Bernardo dreams of having his own home, before he was lived with what he had, but now he wants his family to live in a decent home. He is working very hard towards this goal. 

Bernardo needs to invest in his business in order to grow it, thus he is seeking a loan to buy alcohol such as aguardiente, rum, whiskey, tequila and beer, and also coffee and other drinks.

loans.use: to buy alcohol such as aguardiente, rum, whiskey, tequila and beer, and also coffee and other drinks.

loans.name: Karen Milene

texts.es:
Karen es una mujer muy emprendedora y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cultivando y tratando de cumplir.

Tiene un pequeño negocio de preparación y venta de alimentos y pasabocas de la región.

Con esta actividad intenta día a día  salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por su hija de 5 años quien es el motor de su vida y su motivación para luchar diariamente.

Su mayor dificultad es la competencia del sector, pero con su gran capacidad de trabajo es capaz de sostenerse y progresar.

Karen solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de mesas, sillas y mejorar su estufa y comprar surtido de ingredientes para la preparación de estos alimentos como bebidas.

Con tu ayuda Karen Podrá mejorar las condiciones de su vivenda que es uno de sus más grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Karen is an enterprising and tenacious woman with great desires to which she has developed and tried to achieve. She has a small business preparing and selling meals and snacks from the region. Through this activity she gets ahead day by day and improves the living conditions of her family which is made up of her 5 year old daughter who is the driving force in her life and her motivation to struggle daily.

Her main difficulty is the competition in the market but with her great capacity to work she is capable of sustaining her business and progressing. Karen is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs and improve her stove and buy an assortment of ingredients to prepare her meals and drinks. With your help Karen can improve the condition of her house which is one of her biggest dreams!

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs and improve her stove and buy an assortment of ingredients to prepare her meals and drinks.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 55 years old and widowed with four children. With one child in school, Marietta works very hard to provide for them.

Marietta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as junk foods, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Marietta has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Marietta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as junk foods, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Andres Alcides

texts.es:
Andrés de 40 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado en el centro escolar de la comunidad. está casado y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales solo uno asiste a la escuela. 


Andrés casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a cultivar, ya que su papá le inculcó dicha actividad, además es motorista de un pick up en cual hace viajes cuando lo buscan.


Este crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos para el cultivo de maíz.


Entre sus planes para futuro están comprar ganado ya que tiene terreno donde llevar a pastarlos.
texts.en:
Andrés, 40 years old, finished ninth grade in the community's central school. He is married and has two children of whom only one attends school.

Andrés has been dedicated to farming for almost his whole life since his father taught him this work. Additionally, he is a driver of a pickup in which he makes trips when asked.

He needs this loan to buy inputs for the maize crops.

Among his future plans are to buy cattle since he has land where he can take them to graze.

loans.use: to buy inputs for his maize crops.

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza works hard to support her family. She is married with six children and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Monaliza requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business such as fish net, bamboo, gasoline, and other materials.

Monaliza has been in this business for eight years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business such as fish net, bamboo, gasoline, and other materials.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rowena is 41 years old, and four of her children are currently in school.

Rowena has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish net, bamboo, and other materials for her business.

Rowena has been in this business for nine years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net, bamboo, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 51 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Estela is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for 1 year and also earns additional income from meat vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Los hijos han sido la mayor alegría de Carlos, esos dos muchachos que hoy tienen 10 la mayor y 7 el menor significan todo para él junto con su esposa, quiere darlo todo, sudársela en su taller de reparación de vehículo para poder pagar la educación de sus retoños, algo que lo llena de alegría y ante todo compromiso, porque de él depende el futuro de ellos y como buen padre quiere dar lo mejor de sí en pos de ellos.

Carlos quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de repuestos de vehículos, parachoques, pastas de frenos, parachoques y herramienta para sacar hundidos de los vehículos.
texts.en: Carlos' happiness comes from his children. His two children the oldest is 10 and the youngest 7 are everything to him. He along with his wife want to give them everything, so he toils in his car repair shop in order to pay for the education of his offshoots. This fills him with joy and moreover commitment as their future depends on him and as a good father he wants to give them the best. Carlos is requesting a loan  to buy car parts, bumpers, brake pads and tools to remove parts from vehicles.

loans.use: to buy car parts, bumpers, brake pads and tools to remove parts from vehicles.

loans.name: Integrantes De La Manzana Group

texts.es:
Hay una comunidad perteneciente al Estado de México cuyos habitantes son personas muy trabajadoras. Gran parte de ellos se dedica al cultivo de maíz y a otras actividades como el comercio de bonetería. Muchos suelen viajar a otros puntos del Estado de México para establecer su puesto por varios días, en estos casos dejan de ver a su familia hasta que están de vuelta en la comunidad.
   Itzayana representa a dicha comunidad, es una chica muy alegre y amable que a su corta edad ya tiene grandes aspiraciones en la vida. Está casada desde hace cinco años con Misael con quien ha formado una familia con un niño. La pareja se muestra feliz pues pronto serán padres nuevamente.
   Ella recuerda que veía  a su mamá dedicarse a la compra y venta de bonetería, "siempre me gustó estar en contacto con los clientes mientras mi mamá trabajaba arduamente para sacarnos adelante a mí y a mis hermanos”. Al inicio laboró con su mamá pero hace cinco cinco años comenzó su propio negocio, "mi madre me regaló una bolsa de calcetines y calcetas, con las ganancias de esa bolsa compré dos más y así fue como crecí en el negocio".
   Por ahora vende únicamente en las calles y las ganancias son más elevadas debido a que los clientes pueden observar las mercancía con mucha facilidad. Una de las metas de Itznaya es tener su propia casa ya que por el momento vive en casa de unos familiares.
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son  Catalina quien invertirá en bonetería; Oscar en jarcería y Javier en distintos artículos para el hogar.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el parque del municipio, Itzayana es quien viste la playera de color azul*
texts.en:
There is a community belonging to the State of Mexico whose residents are very hard working people. A large number of them are dedicated to farming maize and to other work like selling hosiery. Many often travel to other parts of the State of Mexico to work for many days. In these cases, they don't see their family until they return to the community.

Itzayana represents such a community. She is a very happy and friendly girl who, at a young age, already has great life aspirations. She has been married for five years to Misael with whom she has started a family with one child. The couple is happy because they will soon be parents again.

She remembers that she saw her mother dedicated herself to buying and selling hosiery. "I always liked to be in contact with customers while my mother worked hard to get my brothers and I ahead." To start, she worked with her mother but five years ago she began her own business. "My mother gave me a bag of socks and stockings. With the earnings from that bag, I bought two more and thus began the business."

For now, she sells only in the streets and the earnings are higher since customers can see the merchandise with ease. One of Itznaya's goals is to have her own house since, for now, she lives in a family member's house.

The rest of the members of the group are Catalina who will invest in hosiery; Oscar in cleaning products and Javier in different household items.

*The photograph was taken in the town park. Itzayana is who you see in the blue colored shirt.*

loans.use: to purchase socks and stockings.

location.town: San Agustin Mextepec, San Felipe del progreso

loans.name: Beautinia

texts.en:
Beautinia is 40 years old and has three children. She is married, and two of her children are still in school.

Beautinia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Beautinia has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Hayati

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Hayati, one of Ruma’s agents. Hayati lives in East Bandung, a semi-urban area located about three hours’ drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Hayati is happily married. Together with her husband, she has three children.

Hayati sells mobile airtime credits and provides mobile payment services for her community. She has been a member of Ruma for almost a year. She knew about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive, who came to her stall.

As the business grows, Hayati is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to her community. Now that you know about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Hayati and improve her business and, accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Hayati is the one who is sitting in her own stall. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn works hard to support her family. She is single with five children and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Marlyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Marlyn has been in this business for eight years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Yanith

texts.es:
Yanith cuenta con una experiencia de 10 años en la actividad de la confección, tiene su taller de confección a terceros en su casa desde hace 4 años. 
Trabaja durante todo el día y con su taller desea generar empleo para personas con muchas necesidades. 

Esta actividad la aprendió de capacitaciones. La ventaja es que ya tiene reconocimiento en el sector y la calidad de sus productos es muy buena, lo que le ha permitido cada vez conseguir más clientes para su negocio y también se ha transformado en buenos pedidos. 

Prefiere trabajar sola durante 10 horas aproximadamente todos los días.
Debido a que en la actualidad su capacidad de producción no alcanza para satisfacer a todos sus clientes, Yanith requiere de un préstamo para comprar Compra de insumos para confección como tela, hilos, agujas, encajes, botones, entre otros, para abastecer su taller.

Su mayor anhelo es salir adelante con su taller de confección y poder tener en su hogar unas mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar junto sus 3 hijos.
texts.en:
Yanith has made a living sewing for 10 years and has owned her own sewing business for 4 years.  She works alone now, but hopes to take on an employee one day.

Yanith took a course to learn to sew.  Her advantage is that she delivers a good service and is known for her work here.  She has picked up many new customers, as a consequence, and seen her business thrive.  She would prefer to work no more than 10 hours a day and cannot meet all the demand for her services because she just doesn't have the time to do so.  

Yanith is applying for a loan that she will use to buy material, thread, needles, buttons and other supplies that she needs to carry on her business.  The investment will allow her to grow her business and continue providing for her 3 children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her sewing business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 34 years old and has five children. She is married, and four of her children are in school.

Mary Ann is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Mary Ann has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase gallons of mineral water needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items such as eggs, oil, charcoal, kerosene, instant noodles, coffee and herbal products as well, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. She is thanking God and you in advance for your continuous financial help, and for a good return on her investment, for it will surely cover their daily sustenance and other health needs.

Susan dreams of having a bigger general store to attract and serve more customers. She prays for good, long health for her and her husband. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, herbal products, charcoal and kerosene to sell at her small store.

loans.name: Maria Sheila May

texts.en:
Maria Sheila May works hard to support her family. She is married with one child and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Maria Sheila May requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish net and other materials for her fishing business.

She has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish net and other materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 31 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy works hard to support her family. She is married with four children and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Daisy has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Vanesa Yuliet

texts.es:
Vanesa, con 20 años de edad, es responsable de su hogar junto con su esposo. 

Desde hace 1 año, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una sala de belleza que inició como alternativa para generar recursos que le permitieran velar por el bienestar de su familia, trabaja sola todos los días de 8:00 am a 8:00 pm, la actividad la aprendió tomando clases en una academia de belleza y poco a poco fue adquiriendo más conocimientos y perfeccionando sus técnicas, lo que le ha permitido darse a conocer en el sector por la calidad de su servicio. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar una silla de pedicura y forros para los muebles de su negocio, así estará en la capacidad de prestar un mejor servicio, pues los clientes estarán más cómodos, lo que le ayudará a mejorar sus ventas y los ingresos que percibe. 

Vanesa con su perseverancia y proyección hacia un futuro, desea hacer crecer su salón de belleza, en el que pueda generar más oportunidades de empleo para madres cabezas de familia, dando como resultado un mejor bienestar no sólo para su familia, sino que aportará para que otras personas puedan disfrutar de mejores condiciones para vivir.
texts.en:
Vanesa at 20 years old is responsible for her household along with her husband. For one year she has been working in her own business, a beauty salon which she started as an alternative to generate resources that allow her to care for the well-being of her family. She works alone everyday from 8 am until 8 pm. She learned the trade by taking classes at a Beauty academy and little by little she has been gaining more knowledge and perfecting her technique. This has allowed her to become known in the sector for her quality of service.

Currently she is requesting a loan to buy a pedicure chair and covers for the chairs in her business which will allow her to offer better service as the clients will be more comfortable. This will help her improve her sales and her income.

Vanesa with her perseverance and looking to the future wants to expand her beauty salon where she can generate more employment opportunities for mothers that are the head of their families. This would result in greater well-being not only for her family but help support other people who can enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a pedicure chair and covers for the chairs in her business in order to offer better service.

loans.name: Arelis Sofia

texts.es:
Arelis es una dulce abuelita de 63 años de edad, trabajadora, responsable, colaborativa, que se dedica a la venta de alimentos, como lo son pasteles, tortas de carne, arepas de carne, básicamente productos fritos que sale a vender a las afueras de su hogar, tomo la decisión de iniciar a vender desde el año 2012. Porque se encontraba sin dinero, es separada de su esposo y no tiene hijos por lo que este negocio significa la única entrada de dinero para que ella se sostenga.

Arelis gracias a las ventas de alimento ha podido cubrir sus necesidades básicas, pero no logra aumentar las ventas. Arelis necesita buscar otra salida si quiere seguir sosteniendo los gastos de su hogar por ello desea iniciar con la venta de mercancía que apoyado de todas las personas que ha logrado conocer tratara de tener éxito y una entrada de dinero extra que caerá muy bien en su hogar.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercancía, principalmente ropa para mujer y hombre juvenil.
texts.en:
Arelis, 63, is a lovely woman, hard-working, responsible, and caring.  She has a food sales business making and selling meat pies and other prepared foods.  She started the business in 2012 and sells what she makes from a space in her house.  The business has been her only means of supporting herself since she separated from her husband.  She has no children.  

Arelis has managed to scrape out a living with the food business, but just that and no more.  She needs to find another way to make a living in order to support herself and has hit on clothing sales because she's seen that other people do very well selling clothing.  

Arelis is applying for a loan that she will use to buy merchandise: clothing, mainly, for young men and women.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Oscar Javier

texts.es:
Oscar es un hombre trabajador y humilde, cualidades que tiene muy bien merecidas ya que su labor de zapatero le han dado la oportunidad de conseguir el sustento para su familia.

Inicio este negocio hace 5 años a través de las enseñanzas de un amigo quien le ofreció la oportunidad de aprender el oficio.

Hoy en día trabaja en la calle con unos ingresos bajos pero ganados con mucho esfuerzo.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar materia prima como cuero, pega, clavos, entre otros, elementos que le permitirán abastecer su negocio y poder generar una mejor producción de calzado.

Ayuda a Oscar a cumplir su sueño de comprar una vivienda propia a través de su trabajo
texts.en:
Oscar is a man who is hardworking and humble, qualities that have very good merits since his work as a cobbler has given him the opportunity to support his family.

He began this business five years ago through the teachings of a friend who offered the opportunity to learn this job.

Today, he works in the street with low but hard earned income.

He is requesting economic support to buy raw material like leather, paste, nails, among other items, elements that will allow him to stock his business and be able to generate a greater production of shoes.

Help Oscar to achieve his dream to buy his own house through his work.

loans.use: to buy raw material like leather, paste, nails, among other items that allow him to stock his business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 43 years old, married with four children. Elsa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and more. Elsa has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years now, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Elsa aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and more

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: As a widowed parent of nine children, Nelia works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell coco lumber business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Nelia is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy more stock of coco lumber to sell in her business for her buy and sell coco lumber business. Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of coco lumber to sell in her business

loans.name: Iim

texts.en:
Hello lenders! This is Iim, one of Ruma's agents. She lives in Majalengka, a regency in West Java, located about a 5-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Iim is happily married, and together with her husband, they have two children, one son and one daughter. 

Iim has become an agent for Ruma’s layaway product designed for lower income communities called 'Mapan'. Mapan enables customers to save up, little by little, by depositing change at agents like Rini, and as their balance grows, it allows customers to make major asset purchases like housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children.  

As a Mapan agent, Rini is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Rini will submit the order via SMS and, within 5-10 days, the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Rini believes that her community will be able to have access to higher quality products with better prices. 

As seen in the photo, Rini is the one who is holding Mapan's poster. She is thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to increase the working capital deposit needed to help community members for big purchases through Ruma's layaway product called Mapan.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Roselyn is 41 years old and has two children are still in school. Roselyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell to her food stall. Roselyn has been in this business for 8 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell to her food stall

loans.name: Nika Eva

texts.en: Nika Eva is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nika Eva is 30 years old and has one child in school. Nika Eva has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nika Eva requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell in the market. Nika Eva has been in this business for 5 years now. In the future, Nika Eva would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia luchador que día con día se esmera en su trabajo para darles lo mejor a sus hijos, él está profundamente agradecido por el crédito al que tuvo acceso pues gracias a este apoyo el logro comprar sus semillas  y fertilizantes para su cultivo de papa, con esta cosecha el logro muy buenas ganancias, es por ello que ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar sus semillas y fertilizantes y poder cultivar en esta temporada.
José tiene el anhelo de comprar un terreno para poder incrementar su cultivo.
texts.en:
José is a hard-working family man who everyday strives in his work to provide his children with the best.

He is deeply grateful for the loan he received because, thanks to this support, he managed to buy his seeds and fertilizers for his potato crop. He made very good profits with this harvest. 

That is why he is now requesting a new loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to farm in this season. José longs to buy a plot to be able to expand his crop.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mercedes Maria

texts.es:
Mercedas, es una joven de 35 años de edad que desde hace algún tiempo se ha dedicado a diversas actividades laborales pero siempre con un deseo en su mente que era el incursionar en el área comercial, fue así como desde inicios del año 2009, monto su negocio de miscelánea, con el cual ha tenido gran acogida durante los años que lleva de funcionamiento. 

Trabaja con 1 empleado durante 8 horas todos los días.
Mercedas se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, amable, con visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por esta razón que se anima a solicitar un crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía como accesorios, protectores de pantalla, ropa, zapatos, útiles, entre otros, con el fin de darle una mejor imagen al negocio, que logre atraer más clientes y así ofrecerles una variedad de productos que satisfagan las necesidades y gustos de todos los que visiten el negocio. 

De esta manera logrará obtener ingresos para continuar aportando a la economía de su hogar y ahorrar para montar varias sucursales de su negocio y así tendrá un futuro más próspero, donde podrá mejorar notoriamente su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedas, 35, worked at many jobs over the years but always with the idea that she would eventually start her own business.  She finally succeeded in starting a business, selling general merchandise, in 2009.  The business was an immediate success and she now has one 1 employee.  

Mercedas works 8 hours a day.  She is friendly, enterprising and tenacious.  She is applying for a loan because she wants to grow the business.  She will use the funds to stock her business with products that she will resell: cell phone accessories, clothing, footwear, utensils and other general merchandise.  The investment will give her a wider range of products to sell and draw more customers to her business.  

Your loan will help Mercedas grow her business and increase her income.  She hopes to extend her business to other parts of town and ensure that she and her family can continue to prosper.

loans.use: to buy various products for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of soaps, 5 shirts, 5 skirts, 5 pairs of trousers, and 5 scarves

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 61 years old and married with five children. Rosita works very hard to provide for them. Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items of groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles etc. 
Rosita has been in this business for 5 years now. She would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles etc

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is 58 years old and widowed with five children. Thelma works very hard to provide for them. Thelma runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as mineral water, soft drinks, canned goods, home product care and other groceries. Thelma has been in this business for 3 years now. In the future, Thelma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as mineral water, soft drinks, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita is 51 years old and has two children. Tita is married and has two children are still in school. Tita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Tita requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. Tita has been in this business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer de experiencia, sabiduría y mucha paciencia.
Es madre de 2 hijos y ha trabajado prácticamente toda su vida para sacarlos adelante.
Ella tiene una pequeña chaza en la que vende jugos de fruta, adicional a esto trabaja en producción y venta de comidas que ella misma prepara en su casa.
