Trabaja todos los días de 5:00 Am  a 3:00 Pm para tener su producto listo y fresco para sus clientes que en su mayoría son los vecinos del sector donde vive.

Ella desea capitalizar su negocio y tener un gran avance de insumos e inventario de productos, por eso acude a un préstamo para comprar surtido de frutas al por mayor para mejorar su producción de jugos.

Una de sus principales dificultades es la falta de dinero para invertir en su negocio pero confía en la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y el buen corazón de los prestamistas de Kiva para sacar su actividad adelante.
texts.en:
Claudia is smart, experienced and patient.  She has 2 children and is working hard to make sure they can get ahead in the world.  

Claudia operates a business making and selling prepared foods and drinks.  She operates the business from a space in her house and generally works every day from 5:00am to 3:00pm.  She starts early to ensure that everything is fresh and available when her customers--neighbors, mostly--come to buy from her.  

Claudia is applying for a loan that she will use to buy bulk supplies of the fruits she needs to make fruit juices.  Her main challenge is digging up funds to grow her business and this investment will give her the capital she needs to continue the business and grow it.

Claudia trusts that the help she is receiving from Corporacion Interactuar and Kiva will allow her to go on building her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her juice business.

loans.name: Kosasih

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Kosasih, one of Ruma’s agents. Kosasih lives in West Bandung, a suburban area located about 3 hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married and he owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He has already joined Ruma for almost a year. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall. 

As the business grows, Kosasih is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Having known about the importance of this loan, your loan will be very useful to help Kosasih improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. Kosasih's goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, a Ruma's latest product called Mapan, so his community can have access to better products with lower prices. As seen in the photo, Kosasih is the one who is standing in his own stall. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more retail stock for supply so as to meet customers` demand and be able to educate his children

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona, 33 years old, is a minimum wage earner in a garment factory in GMA, Cavite. She has been working there for nine long years that proves her patience and dedication to work. As Assistant Line Leader, her job includes supervision of co-workers in addition to the usual washing of garments and washing machines. It’s challenging for her to supervise some disobedient co-workers but she can manage them efficiently.

Rona is still single, but her responsibilities in the family cannot be discounted. In the Philippines where families are known to be so closely knit, single persons are expected to help in their family’s expenses, from basic needs such as food, utilities, siblings’ education, transportation, and incidentals like medication and hospitalization. However, the usual dilemma of low-income earners like Rona is that their salaries cannot suffice to meet their basic needs much less afford incidental expenses like medication or hospitalization. In times of huge financial needs, Rona was drawn to usurious money-lenders who charged her with very high interest rate and captured her automated teller machine (ATM) card as loan collateral. Rona has been longing to pay the balance of her debt and eventually recover her ATM card. She’s a member of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative* where she gained the inspiration to save and acquired more skills in budgeting. She is very much looking forward to your help so she can pay her debt, start anew, and save efficiently so she can better help her family. 

As a responsible and loving daughter, Rona wishes that her mother may have a longer life. She hopes to have her own happy family in the future with decent and better living condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her life and work. *The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for employment. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services. **CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before they start their daily work routines. Bible readings, prayer devotions, and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to buy the basic needs of her family, pay her debts, and recover her ATM card

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania is 50 years old and married with eight children. She runs an agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Epifania is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Epifania has been in this business for 5 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: José Nasario

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 65 años de edad es casado tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 4 y 19 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Santa Lucía Utatlán.
José a pesar de su avanzada edad se esmera día con día para darle lo mejor a su familia, el desde hace veinte años se dedica a la elaboración de pantalones en el lugar de su domicilio.
José gracias a sus años de experiencia cuenta con mucha clientela, es por eso que ahora solicita un préstamo para poder comprar rollos de telas para seguir elaborando pantalones.
El gran sueño de José es poder construir una nueva casa de block, para darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jose, 65, has a lovely family: a wife and two children, 19- and 4-years old, respectively.  The family lives in the small town of Santa Lucia Utatlan. 

Despite his age, Jose takes great pains to support his family.  He has worked day-in and day-out for twenty years, running a tailoring business from a space in his house.  He makes trousers and, thanks to his long experience, has many customers.

Jose is applying for a loan that he will use to buy rolls of material for making trousers.  

His goal for the future is to build a sturdier house so that his family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Safargul

texts.en: Safargul is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in a family of farmers. She lives in a district where the conditions for agriculture are good. She is married and has children. Safargul wants to help her husband to earn money for the family budget. She is responsible, hardworking, and hospitable. She participated in a three-day training provided by IMON for startup clients. Considering the conditions of agriculture in her area, she came to the idea of doing business in agriculture, planting agricultural products and selling them in the domestic market. She additionally sells fruits in the market. She asked for a loan from KIVA and IMON to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is hoping to be supported by KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix the roof of her home

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Djénéba est la femme qui tient la corne du Bélier sur la photo. Agée de 37 ans, elle est Mariée. son mari est un cultivateur. Elle n’a pas été à  l’école, c’est une cliente depuis 5 ans et elle est mère de 7 enfants.
Elle fait cette activité d’embouche ovine depuis plus d’une décennie, et elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnant.
Après la vente son bénéfice peut varier entre 15 000 f à 20 000 f CFA. Avec ses profits elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille : Tel que  la couverture sanitaire, habillements,  la scolarisation de ses enfants et alimentaires.
Elle est à son quatrième  cycles  et souhaite dans l’avenir avoir plus de fonds afin de pouvoir faire fasse au bien naître de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Djénéba is the woman holding a ram by the horn in the photo. She is 37 years old and married to a farmer. She did not attend school. She has been a client for five years and has seven children.  She has been raising sheep for over a decade. She stocks up at nearby markets.

After reselling her livestock, she makes a profit between 15,000 and 20,000 West African francs (CFA). Thanks to this revenue, she provides for her family’s needs, such as healthcare, clothing, school fees for her children and food. She is on her fourth loan cycle. In the future she would like to increase her working capital to be able to improve her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body for her son's transportation services.

loans.name: Igleceria

texts.en:
For 20 years, Igleceria has been working as seamstress in a garment factory in GMA, Cavite. Aside from sewing, her responsibilities include cleaning and maintaining the sewing machines. She’s married to Juanito, a driver, and they are blessed with three children. Igleceria’s minimum wage combined with her husband’s irregular income as a driver cannot meet their growing financial needs. They can provide for basic needs such as food and utilities, but they struggle financially when it comes to their children’s education. Moreover, house repair and improvements lag behind other priorities. With the typhoons that swept the Philippines, their house has been in disrepair. They want to restore and improve their house but their budget priorities are for meeting their basic needs and paying for their children’s education. Also, they no longer want to be enslaved to usurious money-lenders who charge very high interest rates and seize their automated teller machine (ATM) card as loan collateral. It is a blessing that Igleceria became a member of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative* where she got the information that there are other options to acquire a loan. With your kind help she can now have the opportunity to restore and improve their house, a home to their happy family.  

Igleceria dreams for their children to finish their education as it is their most valued inheritance. With a college degree, they have a better chance to escape poverty. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her life and work. *The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for employment. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services. **CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before they start their daily work routines. Bible readings, prayer devotions, and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for house restoration and improvements.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is thankful that she was granted a 35,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan which she will use as part of her working capital to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Ludy dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children a good education. She prays that God will continue to bless her family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 59 years old and married, and she has four children.

Tita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Tita requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Tita has been in this business for 7 years now, and she has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is  20 years old and is studying at the university. She is clever and hard working girl now she is studying at the university. She has three sisters and two brothers so she lives in a big family with 8 members. Her mother doesn't work and her father has health problems. Because of the financial problems her family faces she is often unable to focus on her studying. This loan will help her to complete her studying on time.
 Her mother wanted to work in a farm to get money for her education costs but she didn't find a place to keep her kids so this loan will greatly help the family.

loans.use: to pay for education costs and transport

loans.name: Sabha

texts.en:
Sabha is a woman with 5 children living in a small house in Ajloun in Jordan where there is lack of water. She used to buy drinking water for her family to drink but that talks a lot of money and efforts to bring the water. Sabha wants to dig a well to be able to drink rain water because that will save money and effort and they will be able to find water if they need it. This is especially important in Jordan, a country which is very poor in water, especially in summer.
  If they have a well they will collect rain water to use in summer . It is very difficult to stay for two or three days without water especially for poor people who can't buy water. This loan will solve this problem for the family.

loans.use: to pay for digging a well

loans.name: Blgees

texts.en:
Blgees is a student at high school and she needs to take a lot of lessons and training  to be able to pass her exams. Her family can't pay the costs because they are poor. She has a sister studying in the university and others at school with two small kids. Her mother is a house wife and she has to pay many expenses so Blgees needs this loan as otherwise she will not be able to buy courses and books and to pay fees.
   She has a dream to pass her high school exams with a high mark and to study Engineering at the university to be a famous engineer in the future. With this loan you will help her to make her dreams become true.

loans.use: to pay costs for high school lessons

loans.name: Saja

texts.en: Saja is 21 years old and her father is sick so he left his work. They have a big family with a small salary so they face difficulties in offering the needs of the family. First her parents didn't want to let her study in the university because they don't have money, especially that she has a sister studying in the university, which makes it difficult for her family to pay the fees. Saja took a loan and started studying and this loan will make it possible for her to go on and continue. If she completes studying she can work and help her family and her sisters to study.

loans.use: to pay for higher education costs, transport and buy books

loans.name: Hadeel

texts.en:
Hadeel is a nineteen year old girl and she is studying software engineering in the university. She lives in a village in Ajloun and she is studying in a university in Zarqa which is very far from Ajloun. She has a family with two sisters and three brothers. Her parents are working in a local sector with a small income so they can't meet all the needs of the family. With this loan she will be able to continue her study and to make her dreams become true.
  She is the oldest in the family and everyone hopes that she can complete her study and graduate from the university 
 Previously she tried to work and study at the same time but she didn't find work, so taking the loan will make it easy for her to continue her study.

loans.use: to pay for education costs, transport and buy books and stationary

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is from Dasmariñas, Cavite and has been employed as a seamstress in a garment factory in GMA, Cavite for 11 years now. She basically sews clothes, maintains the sewing machines, and performs other tasks requested of her. She’s married to Glicerio, and they have three children. Anselma’s minimum wage combined with her husband’s irregular income cannot meet their growing financial needs. Anselma’s income usually goes to basic needs such as food and utilities, and she barely earns enough for their children’s education. Moreover, when urgent needs arise, Anselma has no access to banks and other financial institutions. When her mother died lately, Anselma had to borrow money from a loan shark who charged a very high interest rate and seized her automated teller machine (ATM) card as loan collateral. The high interest rate further depleted her budget for their everyday needs. That’s why she’s been longing to pay the balance of her debt and eventually recover her ATM card. She’s a member of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative* where she gained the inspiration to save and acquire more skills in budgeting. She is very much looking forward to your help so she can pay her debt, start anew, and save efficiently so she can better help her family.

Anselma dreams for their children to finish their education as it is their most valued inheritance. With a college degree, they have a better chance to escape poverty. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her life and work. *The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services. **CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before they start their daily work routines. Bible readings, prayer devotions, and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay debt incurred due to death of her mother

loans.name: Cristo Vive Group

texts.es:
Cristo Vive es el nombre de un grupo ubicado en una comunidad mexiquense muy tranquila cuyo distintivo son sus cultivos de nopales de excelente calidad y la actitud dedicada de los habitantes. La mayoría de ellos aún conserva su lengua materna, dentro de sus hogares se puede escuchar largas e interesantes conversaciones en mazahua. Si bien la comunidad es pequeña, la vegetación es extensa y los paisajes muy pintorescos.
   Elia vive en dicha comunidad y es muy amable, sonriente y trabajadora, es un claro ejemplo de la personalidad de los lugareños. Está casada desde hace trece años con el señor Gustavo quien trabaja como auxiliar administrativo en una escuela; juntos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos de los cuales tres estudian en distintos niveles educativos. 
   Ella tiene diecisiete años de experiencia como comerciante, en un inicio vendió ropa para bebés de manera ambulante, recorría las calles de su localidad en busca de clientes, pero desde hace once años encontró otra opción para obtener ingresos. Actualmente compra y vende artículos de fantasía como aretes, bolitas, cortaúñas, pasadores, listones y moños. Elia trabaja todos los días ya sea en el mercado de su municipio o en el puesto que tiene en otro Estado de la República.
   Elia se muestra muy agradecida por los préstamos recibidos anteriormente porque éstos le han ayudado a construir una casa propia ya que antes vivía con sus suegros. Además, con las ganancias obtenidas pudo instalar un pequeño huerto de tomates y nopales que vende en las calles en algunas ocasiones. Con el nuevo préstamo comprara más productos de fantasía como bolitas, pasadores, moños, aretes, pulseras y anillos así como abono para su sembradío de vegetales.
   Las demás integrantes del grupo son Sofía quien invertirá en ropa y nopales; María Guadalupe, en ropa para bebé y Eulalia en artículos de fantasía. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de Elia, se observa parte de los productos que vende, ella es quien carga la bebé*
texts.en:
Cristo Vive is the name of a group that is located in a very peaceful Mexican community.  It stands out for its prickly pear crops and the business activity of its inhabitants.  Most of them still maintain their mother tongue.  In their homes you can hear long and interesting conversations in Mazahua.  Even though the community is small, the vegetation is extensive, and the scenery is very picturesque.  

Elia lives in this community.  She is very friendly, happy, and hard-working.  She is a clear example of the personality of the population.  She has been married to Gustavo for 13 years. He works as an administrative assistant at a school.  Together they have created a family with four children.  Three of the children attend different levels of school.  When she started she sold baby clothes in an itinerant manner.

She has 17 years of experience as a merchant. She traveled the streets in her area looking for customers.  However, 11 years ago she found another opportunity for getting income.  She currently buys and sells costume jewelry like earrings and beaded jewelry.  She also sells nail clippers, pins, ribbons, and bows.  She works every day at the municipal market or at the stand that she has in another state in the republic.   

Elia is very grateful for the previous loans that she received because they helped her to build her own house.  Before that she lived with her in-laws.  Also, with the earnings that she got she was able to set up a small tomato and prickly pear garden.  Sometimes she sell these items on the street.  She will use her new loan to buy jewelry like beaded items, pins, bows, earrings, bracelets, and rings.  She will also buy fertilizer for her plants.

The other members of the group are Sofía, who will buy clothes and prickly pears; María Guadalupe, who will buy baby clothes; and Eulalia, who will buy costume jewelry.

*The photograph was taken at Elia's house.  Some of the products that she sells can be seen.  She is the one carrying the baby.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine, 28 years old, is from Carmona, Cavite and has been employed as a packer in a garment factory in GMA, Cavite for five years now. She’s responsible for folding, pressing, packing, and sometimes shipping clothes and garments. As a female worker, it is not easy for her to carry boxes of clothes but due to her patience and hard work, she willingly does it. She is earning a minimum wage just like her husband, Ronald, who is also a factory worker. They are blessed with a child who is in elementary grade. As a young family, they are quite idealistic and always want the best for their child. But at this stage, they are already burdened with the tuition fee for their child’s education. Their combined income usually goes to basic household needs, utilities and rentals. When it’s time for school enrollment, they look for a reasonable loan and financial assistance but they are being lured by usurious lending agencies with very high interest rates. The couple, especially Lalaine, is trying to avoid these loan sharks knowing that these usurious agencies will require her to surrender her ATM card as loan collateral. It is a blessing that she became a member of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative* where she found another option. It is her prayer that you can help her provide for her child’s tuition and avoid the lure of usurious money lenders. 

She trusts the Lord that her child will finish school through your kind help. For Lalaine and her husband, education is the most valued inheritance that they can give to their child.

Lalaine meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work. *The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for employment. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services. **CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before they start their daily work routines. Bible readings, prayer devotions, and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay her child's tuition

loans.name: Yadiber Arturo

texts.es:
Yadiber es un hombre casado, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable, trabajó con su familia en  diferentes negocios donde adquirió experiencia en las ventas. 
Desde hace 4 años inició con una tienda de abarrotes para trabajarla como independiente y  labora desde las 7:00 am a 10:00 pm  
Yadiber sueña con tener un supermercado a futuro, por lo pronto con el crédito solicitado desea adquirir al por mayor una gran variedad de productos como verduras, granos, frutas, hortalizas etc., y poder brindarle a sus clientes artículos de excelente calidad. 
Con este negocio ha podido salir adelante poco a poco e intentara mejorar su vida y la de su familia al lado de la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
Yadiber is a married man.  He is a very hard-working and very responsible man.  He worked with his family in different businesses where he acquired sales experience.

Four years ago he started a grocery store in order to work with it independently.  He works from 7:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m.  Yadiber dreams of having a supermarket in the future.


He will now use the requested loan to get a big variety of products like vegetables, grains, fruit, and greens, etc. wholesale. This way he will be able to provide his customers with excellent quality products.

With this business he has been able to get ahead little by little.  He will try to improve his life and that of his family together with the Interactuar corporation and the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a big variety of products like vegetables, grains, fruit, and greens, etc. wholesale in order to be able to provide his customers with excellent quality products.

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy entregada a su trabajo pues a sus 55 años de edad trabaja incasablemente todos los días de la semana de lunes a domingo en su negocio de producción de alimentos típicos como tamales. 

Madre de 3 hijos la ve una oportunidad de una entidad que le brinda la confianza de tener un crédito para mejorar su negocio y soñar con su fábrica de producción de alimentos y hacerle creer que es posible alcanzar este sueño. 
Le dedica 5 horas diarias a su negocio.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de una olla industrial, un carro de comidas e insumos como carne y maíz.

Con la ayuda de este crédito la señora Maria producirá mas alimentos y le permitirá obtener mejores ingresos para cada día darle mejores oportunidades de vida a sus hijos
texts.en:
Maria is very dedicated to her work. She is 55 years old and works tirelessly at her job every day of the week, Monday through Sunday, making traditional food like tamales. She works five hours per day.

As a mother of three, she sees in Interactuar's loans an opportunity to improve her business. Their trust allows her to dream about having her own food factory one day and to believe it is possible to make that dream a reality.

She is requesting a loan to buy a commercial-grade pot, a food cart, and ingredients like meat and corn. This loan will allow Maria to increase production and have a better income so that her children can have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy a commercial-grade pot, a food cart, and ingredients like meat and corn.

loans.name: José Enrique

texts.es:
José de 33 años de edad, es padre de un niño de siete años que ya estudia primer grado, está casado y su esposa trabaja en los oficios domésticos del hogar. José estudió hasta sexto grado y luego tuvo que dedicarse al trabajo de jornalero debido a que vivía solo con su madre y tenía que apoyar a sus hermanos.

José trabaja en la alcaldía municipal de la comunidad desde hace siete años como promotor social apoyando al deporte de los niños y jóvenes de la comunidad, trabaja de 8:00 AM a 4:00 PM de lunes a viernes y también trabaja los fines de semana en la agricultura, pues siembra maíz y frijoles para el sostén de la familia.

Él solicita este crédito para comprar abono, pagar de mano de obra y alquiler del terreno donde sembrará maíz y frijol.

Su sueño es apoyar a su hijo en los estudios y tener su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
José is 33 years old, and father of a 7 year old son who is in first grade.  He is married and his wife takes care of the home.  Jose studied until the sixth grade and then had to begin working daily, as he lived with his single mother and had to support his brothers. 

Jose works in the mayor's office as a supporter and promoter of youth sports in the community.  He has done this for 7 years and works from 8:00 a.m.  until 4:00 p.m. from Monday through Friday.  He also works weekends in agriculture.  He farms corn and beans to support his family.  

He is asking for this loan to purchase fertilizer, pay some laborers and rent the land where he will plant the corn and beans.  His dream is to support his son in his studies and to have his own home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pay workers and rent the land where he will plant corn and beans.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita used her previous loan for 15,000 PHP to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. With her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

Amelita requested another loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items such as rice, coffee, soda, instant noodles, and frozen foods. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children.

Amelita dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give all her children a college education to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from God.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Davidson Arley

texts.es:
El es Davidson, un joven de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su familia.

El decidió por iniciar con un negocio de preparación y venta de comidas rapidas desde hace aproximadamente 1 año en un pequeño local con muchas ganas y empuje. 

Este oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica, con la necesidad y el gusto por las ventas, esto le permitió obtener gran experiencia.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio con la ayuda de los prestadores de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para comprar insumos para sus preparaciones como carne y queso, además de comprar publicidad y utensilios de cocina.

Con este crédito podrá sostener su negocio y hacerlo crecer cada día más.
Es un joven que asume retos y los enfrenta con valentía.
texts.en:
He is Davidson.  He is a good-natured and determined young man.  He wishes to progress and to get his family ahead.

A year ago he decided to start a business of making and selling fast food at a small place.  He did this with great desire and drive.  He  learned this line of work in an empirical manner out of necessity and the enjoyment of sales.  This allowed him to get great experience.

He now wishes to give his business a little boost with the help of the Kiva lenders and the Interactuar Corporation.  That is the reason he needs a loan to buy supplies like meat and cheese for the food he prepares.  He will also buy publicity and cooking utensils.  With this loan he will be able to sustain his business and make it grow more each day.

He is a young man who takes on challenges and confronts them bravely.

loans.use: to buy supplies like meat and cheese for the food he prepares and to buy publicity and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Miriam Del Socorro

texts.es:
Miriam es una mujer de 53 años de edad, se dedico inicialmente al negocio de las confecciones en el cual duro tres años como operaria, después de pasar este periodo de tiempo inicio manejando un taller con un familiar el cual le enseño el oficio y la guiaba en todo el proceso para adquirir su propio negocio. 

Es casada y es madre de dos hijos. Hace poco tiempo es una mujer independiente que gracias a los micro créditos tiene la posibilidad de ser su propia jefe y generar un empleo pues su pecera es reconocida por su buen servicio al cliente; solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para confección como tela, hilos, agujas, encajes, botones, entre otros, para abastecer su taller; su principal sueño es tener un taller con muy buena producción, cómodo agradable en el cual pueda encontrar una gran variedad de prendas, crecer día a día como empresaria generando empleo y calidad de vida a los seres queridos que la rodean.
texts.en:
Miriam is a 53-year-old woman who has dedicated herself to the dress-making business, after working three years as a sewing machine operator. After passing through this time period, she began to manage a shop with a family member who taught her the business and guided her through all the process of acquiring her own enterprise.

Miriam is married and has two children. Recently, she became an independent woman who, thanks to these micro-credits, has the chance of being her own boss and generating a job. She is now known for her good customer service.

Miriam is requesting a loan to purchase sewing inputs such as cloth, thread, needles, fittings, and buttons, among other items to supply her shop.

Miriam's principal dream is to have a shop with very good production and agreeable comfort in which she can undertake a great variety of clothing, growing day by day as an entrepreneur, and generating employment and a good quality of life for the loved ones who surround her.

loans.use: to buy sewing inputs such as cloth, thread, needles, fittings, and buttons, among other items.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro es un campesino de 50 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 
Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee cultivos de cafe, cultivos que atiende todos los días y las cosechas son vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Caparrapi, adicionalmente, realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de sus padres que tanto lucharon para sacarlo adelante. 

Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado en la Corporación Interactuar, comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor como abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros, con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha, más productiva y asi mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos.

Pedro, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 50 year old farmer. He is hard working and modest. Since he was a child he learned to do all of the work in the field, thanks to the teaching of his parents.
This has allowed him to progress and now he has his own coffee crops that he looks after every day and the harvests are sold in the marketplace of the Caparrapi municipality. Additionally, he works as a day labourer in different farms in the region and this complements his income which he uses to look after the wellbeing of his parents that fought so hard to get him ahead in life.

With the support of the loan applied for through Interactuar, he will buy farming supplies in bulk such as manure, pesticides, fertilisers and others, with which he will continue to look after his crops and he will have a better harvest which is more productive and thus, he will improve his income when selling his products.

With his entrepreneurial spirit, strength and tenacity, Pedro wants to continue to fight to fulfil his dream of having his own farm in which he can grow a wider variety of products and thus improve the profitability of the business, guaranteeing economic stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies in bulk such as manure, pesticides, fertilisers and others.

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en: Patrice is 52 years old and she is married with 4 children aged between 8 and 22. She owns restaurant and she has been in the business for the past 18 years while her husband is a businessman. With the loan, she would like to buy banana,Cassava to sell. The profits from the business will used to buy a piece of land. In future, she aims to earn at least 100,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy banana, Cassava to sell.

loans.name: Karen Mae

texts.en:
Karen Mae is 38 years old with 3 children ages 11, 4, and 3 years old. She is a hardworking entrepreneur.

Karen Mae operates a sewing shop where she makes curtains, pillow cases, and furniture covers. At first she sold all of her products retail, but now she has buyers who buy her products in bulk. She also has 3 sewers to help her sew the orders she receives. 

Karen Mae has been a SEED partner for 2 years. Through the loan, her business has expanded into wholesale, and now she also sews artisanal bags made of buri (dried palm leaves) and fabric. 

Karen Mae's opportunity came when one of her regular customers ordered curtains and bags in bulk from her. She wanted to grab the chance to supply the demand to increase her income and expand her business.

Karen Mae is now requesting a loan amount of 100,000 PHP to buy 100 yards of assorted linen, silk, cotton, polyester, and blended fabrics and materials for curtains, pillow cases, and furniture covers and to buy buri and other materials for handcrafted bags.

Karen Mae's goal is to improve her business and add clothes bags in the future. She is working hard to save for the education of her 3 children.

loans.use: To buy 100 yards of assorted fabrics and materials for curtains, pillow cases, and furniture covers, and to buy buri and other materials for artisanal bags

loans.name: Ana Catalina

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer trabajadora, organizada y perseverante, dedicada a su familia y apasionada por su labor. 

Desde hace 2 años es comerciante independiente, tiene una tienda ubicada en el centro de la ciudad, allí trabaja todos los días durante 10 horas cuenta con la ventaja de no tener mucha competencia, por lo que ya es reconocida por los diferentes ciudadanos que se han convertido en sus principales clientes. 

Con el apoyo del crédito fortalecerá sus inventarios comprando mecato, dulces, chocolatinas, galletería, esto le permitirá tener mayor variedad disponible para ofrecer a sus clientes y así aumentar las ventas. 

Ana manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir fortaleciendo y acreditando su negocio, para que le garantice mayor rentabilidad y así tener la capacidad económica para adquirir una casa propia en la que pueda disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is a hardworking woman who is organized and persistent.  She is dedicated to her family and passionate about her job.  For the last two years she has been an independent storekeeper.  She has a store located in the city center where she works ten hours a day, every day.  She has the advantage of not having much competition because so many locals have become her main customers.  

With the support of the loan she can fortify her inventory by purchasing  pastries, candies, chocolates, cookies and have a better variety of goods for her customers. This will increase sales.  Ana says that her desire is to continue strengthening and building her business to guarantee better profitability.  This way she will have the economic ability to purchase her own home where she can enjoy a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase pastries, candies, chocolates, cookies and have a better variety of goods for her customers.

loans.name: Hesti

texts.en:
Hesti lives in South Serang, a semi-urban area located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She sells mobile airtime credits and provides mobile payment services for her community. She joined Ruma because she wants to learn about how to become an entrepreneur, as well as give more contribution to her community. Hesti is a friendly and cheerful person. Her community sees her as a trusted and informative mobile airtime credits and bill payment services provider. 

As the business grows, Hesti needs additional capital and is requesting a loan, which she will use to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to her community. Hesti's goal is to serve an e-commerce business for her community.

loans.use: to sell mobile airtime credits and provide bill payment services.

loans.name: Saepudin

texts.en: Saepudin lives in Indramayu, an area in West Java, located about four hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married, and he owns a stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile airtime credits for his community. He joined PT Rekan Usaha Mikro Anda (Ruma), Kiva's partner, a year ago. As the business grows, Saepudin is hoping to get a loan from Kiva to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Your loan will be very useful to help Saepudin improve his business and his community, which needs access to communication services. Saepudin's goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community using Ruma's latest product called Mapan, so his community can have access to better products with lower prices. Saepudin is shown in the photo standing in his stall. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid mobile phone credit for helping community members who need access to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Arden Nicolás

texts.es: Arden de 54 años, posee una gran experiencia en el campo de la confección de ropa para toda la familia, labor que ejerció cuando residía en el vecino país de Venezuela en donde nació su idea de negocio en el año 2000. Inició confeccionando ropa a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares,  y con el pasar del tiempo su gran experiencia en este arte le permitió laborar para empresas y talleres de confecciones de este país. Sin embargo la problemática política y social por la que atraviesa Venezuela, lo afectaron y decidió en el año 2014 viajar a Barranquilla municipio de la costa Caribe Colombiana, en donde tuvo que hacer un nuevo comienzo y adecuar su taller de confecciones, en el que actualmente maneja contratos para elaborar uniformes con empresas y colegios.   Este ha sido el desafío más representativo en su carrera, sin embargo este emprendedor hombre se repone cada día más y está presto para abrir nuevos mercados.  Arden está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en materia prima e insumos para la confección de ropa, como telas, hilos, botones, pellones, cremalleras y demás accesorios.  Esta inversión le permitirá cumplir oportunamente con los compromisos y entregas de productos. Su meta a futuro es posicionarse en el  mercado local y tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Arden is 54 years old and is highly experienced in making clothes for the whole family. He was doing this job when he used to live in the neighbouring country Venezuela, where he came up with his business idea in 2000. He started making clothes for his neighbours, friends and relatives. Over the course of time his wide experience in this art allowed him to work for companies and tailoring workshops of this country.

However, the social and political problems Venezuela is going through affected him and in the year 2014 he decided to travel to Barranquilla –town in the Colombian Caribbean coast. Here he had to start again and adapt his tailoring workshop. He currently has contracts with companies and schools to make uniforms. This has been the biggest challenge in his career. Yet this enterprising man does better every day and is ready to enter into new markets.

Arden is applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to invest in raw materials and supplies such as cloths, threads, buttons, interfacings, zips and other accessories to make clothes. This investment will allow him to meet his commitments and products deliveries in time. His future goal is to position himself in the local market and have a house of his own.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials and supplies such as cloths, threads, buttons, interfacings, zips and other accessories to make clothes.

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
Desde hace 1 año se viene dedicando a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares que conocen a Ana y quieren que también progrese en su actividad.

Desde muy niña sintió gran afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de productos de belleza y ropa para aumentar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas, obteniendo así unos buenos ingresos para su hogar

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos y al acompañamiento de la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Ana is a very enterprising woman who is very eager get ahead and improve her situation. For the past year, she has been selling products by catalog, such as clothing, accessories, beauty supplies, and household items. She sells these products mainly to friends, neighbors, and relatives who know Ana and want her business to move forward.

Ever since she was a little girl, she always had an interest and a knack for sales, so today she is very good at her business thanks to her kindness and excellent customer service skills.

She is requesting a loan to buy assorted beauty supplies and clothing in order to increase her inventory and improve sales. This will allow her to obtain a good income for her home. She hopes to be able to get ahead thanks to the support from Corporación Interactuar and the kindhearted people who support this sort of projects.

loans.use: to buy assorted beauty products and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fuel conversion kit for her husband's auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Priscile

texts.en:
Priscile is 33 years old. She is married with three children aged between 8 and 12 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 6 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay the workers who harvested her maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who her harvested maize.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 42 and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Her life partner is Eduardo, who is a taxi driver. She manages their household and has a business to augment their income to meet their daily household needs. Rhoda operates a general store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store that sells fresh, dry, and packaged products directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of 600 PHP a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting an 8000 PHP loan that she will use to buy grocery items such as instant noodles, rice, eggs, coffee, soda and other grocery items. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her and for a good return on her investment. Rhoda hopes to maintain and grow her business so they can have a better life. She prays for good health. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items to sell at her store.

The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 38 years old. He is married with six children aged between 4 and 18 years old, five of whom all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 17 years, while his wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de 44 años de edad, que desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a trabajar en diferentes actividades, actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes que un familiar le cedió para que la trabajara y generara ingresos para sustentar los gastos del hogar.

Este negocio lo atiende todos los días de 7 am a 8 pm y, a pesar de la competencia que existe en el sector, ha obtenido buenos resultados, generando ingresos suficientes para que a sus 3 hijos no les haga falta nada.

El crédito que solicita con la Corporación Interactuar es un apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor como mecato, lácteos, galletería, granos, entre otros, esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades inmediatas de sus clientes, aumentando las ventas e ingresos que recibe por su labor.

Luz, con su espíritu de superación y las ganas de salir adelante con su familia, lo impulsan a seguir luchando y avanzar para cumplir el sueño de adquirir una casa propia, en la que pueda disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luz is a 44-year-old woman, who followed different occupations for a long time. Currently, she has a grocery store that a relative handed over to her so that she could run it and generate income to cover her household expenses.

She works from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. every day. Despite the competition in the area, she has obtained good results and generated enough income to give her three children everything they need.

She is requesting a loan from Corporación Interactuar to buy an assortment of goods wholesale such as "mecato" [packed lunch], dairy products, cookies, and grains, among other products. This purchase will allow her to offer a wider variety of products to meet her customers' immediate needs. In this way, her sales and income will increase.

Luz's spirit of achievement and desire to get ahead together with her family drive her to keep on working hard and moving forward to fulfill her dreams: buying her own home—where she and her family will enjoy a better quality of life—and providing her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of goods wholesale such as "mecato" [packed lunch], dairy products, cookies, and grains, among other products.

loans.name: Taufik

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Taufik, one of Ruma’s agents. Taufik lives in Depok, an area located about one hour thirty minutes drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married. Together with his wife, they have two children. Taufik owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits for his community. He already joined Ruma for almost a year. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall. 

As the business grows, Taufik is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Taufik improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services.  As seen in the photo, Taufik is the one who is standing. He thanks you for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community.
