loans.name: El Lindero Group

texts.es:
El recorrido para llegar a cierta comunidad oaxaqueña es muy pintoresco ya que se pueden observar varias fincas de limón y plantaciones de árboles de hule y de caña de azúcar. Este último es el cultivo más sobresaliente de la región. Durante la época de zafra o cosecha, los habitantes pasan largas jornadas en el campo para que los ingenios o fábricas puedan comenzar la producción de azúcar, lo que reactiva la economía de manera sorprendente.
   Dentro de la localidad se formó el grupo El Lindero cuyos integrantes y actividades son: Ramona quien vende pescado; Vanesa, verduras; Gregoria, refresco; Catalina, abarrotes; María, comida; Liliana, ropa y Paulina quien maneja un molino de nixtamal. 
   Doña Paulina es una gran mujer que se ha dedicado a cuidar de sus cinco hijos quienes le han dado sentido a sus días desde que enviudó. Doña Pau, como todos la conocen, habla mazateco y conserva aún sus tradiciones.  Ella decidió invertir sus ahorros en la compra de un molino de nixtamal puesto que anteriormente era necesario recorrer diez minutos de terracería a orilla de la carretera para moler una porción de maíz.
   El servicio del molino está disponible de lunes a domingo a partir de las 5:00 am, y continua hasta las 3:00 pm cuando debe lavar las piedras y paredes de la máquina, no obstante, si llegan más clientes con su recipiente lleno de granos de maíz, doña Pau los atiende con gusto. “Yo estaba acostumbrada a moler en petate, así se nos educaba antes pues no había licuadora y las posibilidades de acudir a un molino de nixtamal eran 1 de 10” comenta Doña Pau quien ahora es una experta en su actividad. 
   Con las ganancias obtenidas y la oportunidad del préstamo invertirá en la compra de dos piedras para molino y un contenedor para agua de 500 litros con la intención de no tener que recorrer un largo camino y sacar agua del pozo cada que lava su equipo. 
   Doña Paulina piensa sembrar maíz en el patio de su casa para venderlo ya que por el momento también vende masa: “lo importante es no darse por vencido y hacerle frente a cada una de las situaciones que nos presente la vida”. 
   Las integrantes de El Lindero agradecen por brindarles una oportunidad de crecimiento con cada uno de los préstamos otorgados.
*En la fotografía Doña Pau se encuentra de pie delante de Catalina quien viste blusa color gris, en la fotografía también aparece uno de los hijos de Vanesa.
texts.en:
The route that takes you to a certain community in Oaxaca is very picturesque since you can see numerous lemon, rubber and sugar cane plantations. The last of these is the region's principal crop. During harvest time, the inhabitants spend long days in the fields so that the mills or factories can begin to produce sugar, which revives the economy to a surprising extent.

A group called El Lindero has been set up in the area, whose members and businesses are: Ramona, who sells fish; Vanesa, vegetables; Gregoria, soft drinks; Catalina, groceries; María, food; Liliana, clothes; and Paulina, who runs a corn mill.

Paulina is a great woman who devotes herself to caring for her five children, who have given meaning to her days since she was widowed. Pau, as she is known to everyone, speaks mazateco and still preserves its traditions. She decided to invest her savings in the purchase of a corn mill since she used to have to travel for ten minutes on a dirt track to reach the highway to grind a portion of corn.  
   
Her milling service is available Monday to Sunday from 5:00 am, and goes on until 3:00 pm, when she must wash the stones and walls of the machine. However, if more customers arrive with their containers full of grains of corn, Pau is happy to attend them. "I was used to grinding corn in a palm leaf - that's how we used to be taught, because there was no machine to do it and corn mills were hard to find," says Pau, who is now an expert in her trade.

With the money she has made and this loan, she will invest in two mill stones and a 500 litre water tank, so that she doesn't have to make a long journey to fetch water from the well every time she washes her equipment.

Paulina plans to sow corn in the yard outside her house, since she now sells corn paste, too: "the main thing is not to give up and to face every situation that life presents us with head on."

The members of El Lindero are grateful for the opportunity for growth given by each of the loans they have received.

In the photo, Pau is standing in front of Catalina, who is wearing a grey top. One of Vanesa's daughters also appears in the photo.

loans.use: two millstones and a 500 litre water tank.

loans.name: Solidaria Mujer Con Vissión De Exito Group

texts.es:
Solidaria Mujer
Con Visión de éxito


El grupo Solidaria Mujer con Visión de Éxito  solicita su tercer préstamo en Fundación Mujer, ha demostrado una excelente conducta de pago y buena gestión de sus actividades, está integrado por Argerie  Presidenta, Xinia  Tesorera, Ana Lorena  y Consuelo Vocal. El grupo cumple con las 3 reglas de oro, mantienen un ahorro por 5,000 colones, se reúnen una vez al mes y llevan al día su libro de actas. Las integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio de ropa, zapatos y joyería de oro, producto que adquieren tanto en San José como en Puntarenas. Tienen una cartera de clientes que se distribuye en la zona de Barranca y El Roble en la provincia de Puntarenas, en la costa del pacífico de Costa Rica, atiende en sus barrios de residencia, en visitas regulares de cobro y venta de mercadería.

Argerie, la presidenta del grupo es una joven de 21 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo de 4 años, por el que trabaja y busca un mejor futuro, su esposo le apoya en el negocio, viven en la zona de Barranca de Puntarenas, lugar donde existen pocas opciones de empleo y el apoyo de un crédito permite invertir para crecer en el negocio y buscar nuevas opciones de ingreso. Vende ropa, sandalias y bisutería que consigue en comercios del valle central y revende en su lugar de residencia.

El grupo tiene una amplia experiencia en el comercio, algunas de más de 20 años, conociendo bien su mercado, proveedores y clientes, por lo que sus inversiones van dirigidas a obtener el mayor beneficio, manejan ya un capital de trabajo importante,  lo que demuestra una buena gestión de los préstamos anteriores, logrando ampliar la gama de productos que ofrecen y el número de clientes que atiende.

Todas son mujeres jefas de hogar, con hijos y obligaciones, desean unir sus fuerzas para salir adelante, comprando productos para vender a sus clientes. Todas tienen su clientela y una amplia experiencia en el comercio,  venden ropa, sandalias, perfumes entre otros artículos, conocen bien su mercado, proveedores y clientes, por lo que sus inversiones van dirigidas a obtener el mayor beneficio, desean aumentar su catálogo para las ventas de la temporada del día del padre y día de la madre próximos a celebrarse en  Costa Rica.
texts.en:
The group "Solidaria Mujer con Visión de Éxito" [United Women with Vision of Success] is requesting its third loan through Fundación Mujer.  This group has demonstrated excellent conduct with payment and good management of their businesses.  It is made up of Argerie as the President, Xinia as Treasurer, and Ana Lorena and Consuelo as members.  The group complies with three golden rules: they maintain a savings of 5,000 colones, they meet once a month, and they maintain a record book.  The members of the group make a living selling clothes, shoes, and gold jewelry, product that they acquire in both San José and Puntarenas.  They have groups of customers distributed in the region of Barranca and El Roble in the Puntarenas province, on the Pacific coast of Costa Rica.  They attend to their neighborhoods of residence, in regular visits for collection and sale of merchandise.

Argerie, the president of the group, is a young woman of 21 years.  She is married and has a 4-year-old son, for whom she works and looks for a better future.   Her husband supports her in the business.  They live in the area of Barranca de Puntarenas, where there are few employment options and the support of a loan allows her to invest to grow her business and search for new options for income.  She sells clothes, sandals, and jewelry that she gets in the shops in the central valley and re-sells at her place of residence.  

The group has extensive experience in the trade, some more than 20 years, knowing their market, suppliers, and customers well, so that their investments are directed to obtain the greatest benefit.  They already handle significant working capital, which shows good management of the previous loans, managing to extend the scale of products that they offer and the number of customers they serve.  

All of the women are heads of household, with children and obligations.  They want to unite their forces to get ahead, buying products to sell to their customers.  All have their clientele and extensive experience in the business.  They sell clothing, sandals, and perfumes among other things.  They want to increase their inventory for the upcoming holidays of Father's Day and Mother's Day celebrated in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, perfume, and jewelry made of steel and plated gold.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy steel and gold-plated jewelry

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
:Doña Ana tiene 46 años de edad, es madre jefa de hogar, se dedica al comercio, ha sido clienta de Fundación Mujer por mucho tiempo, a través del cual ha demostrado ser una mujer muy esforzada, responsable y emprendedora. Uno de sus principales logros ha sido el tener su casa propia, donde se refleja lo dedicada y ordenada que es. Cabe destacar que la pensión que reciben sus hijos es voluntaria, menos de la mínima y lo que ella genera en su microempresa es un gran aporte al hogar. En los diferentes créditos ha tenido excelente moral de pago lo cual le respalda en la solicitud de este crédito. 
 Tiene 20 años de estar con la actividad productiva, actualmente ella viaja a México y Panamá  para traer mercadería cada tres meses. Su local esta en la parte del frente de su casa , un aposento que tiene adaptado como bazar donde además de la mercadería que trae , exhibe otros productos como las manualidades que ella misma confecciona.Ella atiende diferentes clientas en Alajuelita y barrios aledaños, ha logrado consolidar una cartera de 30 a 60 clientas que la esperan cada vez que regresa de los viajes para comprarle variedad de mercadería que trae. Desea este crédito para invertir en compra de mercadería, más en esta época que son ventas altas.
texts.en:
Ana is a 46 year-old mother and head of household. She works in commerce and has been a client of Fundación Mujer [Woman Foundation] for a long time, through which she has proved to be a hardworking, responsible and enterprising woman. One of her main achievements has been to have her own home, which reflects how dedicated and organized she is. It is worth pointing out that the child support her children get is voluntary and less than the minimum, and what she earns in her micro-enterprise is a great contribution to the household. 

She has exhibited excellent payment ethic in her loans, which backs her in the request of this loan. She has been in this business for 20 years and currently travels to Mexico and Panama every three months to get merchandise. Her place of business is in the front part of her house in a room that has been adapted as a shop, where in addition to the merchandise she brings back, she exhibits other products such as handicrafts that she makes herself. 

She serves clientele in Alajuelita and neighboring districts and has been able to build a portfolio of 30 to 60 clients who await her each time she returns from her trips in order to shop from the variety of merchandise that she brings back. She wants this loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise, especially at this time of year when sales are high.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Mugwamporo

texts.en: Mugwamporo, 32 years old, is married and has 3 children aged between 2 and 12 years; two of them go to school. For the past 4 years, he has had a business selling spare parts. Mugwamporo would like to use this loan to buy more spare parts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house. Mugwamporo wishes to earn at least 200,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en: Dativa, 43 years old, is married and has 7 children aged between 7 and 23 years; they all go to school. For the past 6 years, she has had a business selling sacks. Dativa's husband is a farmer. She would like to use this loan to buy more sacks and jelly cans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In the future, Dativa aims to earn at least 90,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: To buy more sacks and jelly cans to sell.

loans.name: Florien

texts.en: Florien, 49 years old, is married and has 7 children aged between 5 and 25 years; they all go to school. For the past 12 years, he has owned a shop. His wife is a businesswoman. Florien would like to use this loan to buy more cooking oil, salt and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a car for his business. In the future, Florien aims to earn at least 300,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en: Theogene, 45 years old, is married and has 9 children aged between 1 month and 20 years; 7 of them go to school. For the past 12 years, he has had a business making and selling furniture. His wife is a businesswoman. Theogene would like to use this loan to buy more wood for making cupboards, chairs and sofa sets to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay his children's school fees and to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more wood for making cupboards, chairs and sofa sets to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes, 50 years old, is married and has 6 children aged between 9 and 26 years; they all go to school. For the past 12 years, she has had a business selling empty bottles and crates. Agnes would like to use this loan to buy more crates of beer and empty bottles to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare. In the future, Agnes wishes to earn at least 100,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: To buy more empty bottles and crates of beer to sell.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.ru: Раиса, 60 лет, в разводе, есть сын. У Раисы высшее образование, по специальности биолог, за свою трудовую деятельность работала- учителем биологии,17 лет  в лаборатории агрономом, 5 лет химиком по охране природы. На протяжении уже 20 лет занимается сельским хозяйством, знания Раисы очень помогают ей в этом.  В хозяйстве есть корова, бычок, нетель, 5 овец. На 0,62 Га земли посеян клевер для скота и на 0,24 Га - 230 кустов смородины для реализации. Скот в живом виде она реализует на местном рынке. Начав этот бизнес с 4,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду Раисы, ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Этих средств не хватает на  достойную жизнь, сын Раисы реставрирует автомобили, но заработок не постоянный. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Раиса обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычка для откорма и перепродажи, и семян картофеля для посадки. Доходы от кредита Раиса планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, улучшение благосостояния семьи, а также накопить на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Raisa is 60 years old, divorced, and has a son. She has a higher education, specializing as a biologist, and during her career she has worked as a biology teacher, for 17 years as an agronomist in a laboratory, and for five years as a chemist protecting nature. For the last 20 years she has farmed, and Raisa's knowledge really helps her in this. She has a cow, a steer, a heifer, and five sheep. Clover for the livestock is sown on 0.62 hectares of land, and on 0.24 hectares there are 230 currant bushes for sale. She sells her livestock live at the local market. Having started this business with 4,000 som (KGS), thanks to Raisa's hard work her activity brings in about 10,000 som (KGS) per month which is the basis for covering the family's food expenses and everyday needs. This money is not enough for a decent life. Raisa's son restores cars, but his earnings are not regular. In order to further develop her business, Raisa has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a steer for fattening and resale, and potato seeds to sow. Raisa plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing her business, improving her family's well-being, and also saving up for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy a steer and potato seeds in order to invest in her business and increase her income.

loans.name: Raul Alfredo

texts.es: Don Raúl de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 10 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar el lugar donde tiene su negocio que es el que muestra la fotografía construyendo las paredes pero como no tiene de suficiente capital está solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos,  hierro y pago de mano de obra y así poder tener un mejor lugar para su negocio.
texts.en:
Don Raul is 54 years old and lives in his own home with his wife. He has made a living selling fruits and vegetables for the past 10 years. He manages to to pay the household expenses with what he receives from his sales. He wants to improve his place of business, as shown in the photograph, by building walls. 

Because he does not have sufficient capital, he is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral to buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron, and to pay for labor so that he can have a better place of business.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Philomene

texts.en:
Philomene is single 30-year-old woman who  is an agent of Tigo cash and sells air time and sim cards. She  has been in a business for 2 years. She would like to buy more cards and air time for sell. 

The profits from the business will go into savings.

loans.use: to buy more cards and air time..

loans.name: Sylvain

texts.en:
Sylvan is a 28-year-old is married man with a 4-year-old child. 

He sells food stuffs and has been in a business for the past 2 years. He would like to buy more beans, ground nuts, and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be put into savings

loans.use: to buy more beans, ground nuts, and sorghum.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is a 38-year-old married woman with 8 children between the ages of 5 and 18; all attend school. She owns a shop and has been in a business for 9 years. She will use the loan to buy cooking oil and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and she plans to save money.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a 39-year-old married woman with 6 children who are between the ages of 1 and 20;, 3 attend school. 

She sells soft drinks and been in a business for 6 years. Her husband is a farmer. She will use the loan to buy  soda and juice. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

 In future, she aims to earn at least 100,000 per month

loans.use: to buy soda and juice.

loans.name: Appolinarie

texts.en:
Appolinarie is a 49-year-old married woman with 6 children who are between the ages of 12 and 26; all attend school. 

She sells jerrycans and has been in a business for the past 15 years. She will use the loan to buy more jerrycans  and sacks. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy  jerrycans  and sacks

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.en:
Zulaika is a 52-year-old married woman. She has sold crafts  for 10 years. 

She will used the loan to buy more flowers and baskets to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

 In future, she wishes to earn at least 200,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy more flowers and baskets to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 36-year-old married woman with 6 children who are between the ages of 1 and 17. 

She sells foodstuffs and she has been in a business for  13 years. She will use the loan to buy sorghum, beans, and bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children. 

In the future, she wishes to earn at least 300,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum, beans, and bananas.

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.en:
Anna Marie is a 58-years-old married woman who has sold food for 10 years. Her husband is a business man. 

She will use the loan to buy cassava and Irish potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will used to buy a piece of land. In the future, she aims to earn at least 100,000 RWF per month

loans.use: to buy cassava and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Dative is a 58-year-old married woman who has sold construction stones for 10 years. Her husband is a business man. 

She will use the loan to buy more stones for building. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house a house. In the future, she aims to earn at least 100,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy more stones for building..

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is a 50-year-old married woman with 5 children who are between the ages of 2 and 26.

She has owned a bar for 15 years and will use the loan to buy more beer. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare. 

In the future, she wishes to earn at least 120,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Ainur

texts.ru: Айнур, 50 лет, не замужем, мать 3 детей. У Айнур - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1992 году, с покупки скота на 12,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Айнур, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, лошадь, а также есть земельный надел размером 0,60 ГА, на котором она выращивает картофель и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 3,700 сом (KGS). Этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому Айнур твердо решила развить свой бизнес и обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (kgs) на покупку теленка для откорма и увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнур планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и улучшение материальных условий ее семьи.
texts.en: Ainur is 50, unmarried, and the mother of three children. She has a high school education and earns the main income for her family by raising livestock and planting crops, which she began in 1992 with a livestock purchase of 12,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Ainur's hard work, she currently has two cows, a horse, and a 0.6 hectare plot of land where she grows potatoes and clover. Her monthly income is 3,700 som (KGS). This amount is nowhere near enough to live on, which is why Ainur made up her mind to expand her business. She applied for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy a calf to fatten and increase her herd. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in acquiring more livestock in the future and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a calf in order to increase her income

loans.name: Consessa

texts.en:
Consessa is 21 years old. She is married, with a 1 year old child, who is too young for school. She sells foodstuffs and she has been in a business for 2 years.  Her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan, she would like to have stock of Irish potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In future, she aims to earn at least 100,000 per month.

loans.use: To have stocks of Irish potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 27 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 3 years. She owns a beauty parlor and she has been in business for the past 4 years. With the loan, she would like to buy equipment such as combs and other items for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare. In the future, she wishes to earn at least 300,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy beauty salon equipment to sell

loans.name: Aline

texts.en: Aline is 31 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 4 and 10 years. 2 of them go to school.  She sells foodstuffs and she has been in business for 2 years. Her husband is a farmer. With the loan, she would like to buy more cassava, beans and sorghum for selling. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In future, she aims to earn at least 200,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more cassava, beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Berwa Group

texts.en:
Berwa is a group led by Patricie who is 57 years old. The group name means “Be Smart” in English. She is married with eight children aged between 12 and 37 years. 

She has a shop and has been doing business for the past 7 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives.  With the loan, she would like to buy more soap, sugar; salt and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil for selling.

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en:
Claudette is 34 years old. She is married with 4 children, aged between 2 and 9 years. 2 of them go to school. She owns a mini market and she has been in business for the past 7 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more milk and cake for selling. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare. In future, she wishes to earn at least 200,000 per month

loans.use: To buy more milk and cake for sell.

loans.name: Meredis Isabel

texts.es: Residente en un barrio ubicado al sur occidente de Barranquilla, Meredis es madre de tres hijos mayores de edad a quienes ofreció bienestar. Ella nació en una familia de comerciantes donde aprendió este arte y a sus 50 años de edad cuenta con una larga trayectoria en la comercialización de víveres, ropa y gasodomesticos.  Su clave de éxito ha sido el empeño y dedicación que entrega en su activadad, la cual ejerce de lunes a sábado a partir de las 2 p.m. a 7 p.m. ofreciéndoles a sus familiares y amigos estos artículos que son de primera necesidad en sus hogares.  Ella está aplicando a un credikiva en pro de incrementar sus ingresos e invertir en víveres como aceite, arroz, granos y demás, también en ropa y calzado y gasodomesticos.  Con quince años de experiencia y una clientela fidelizada, ella considera que esta inversión dinamizará sus ventas y con ello sus ingresos.  A través de su trabajo ella cree que mejorará su condición de vida por ello su meta de negocio es ampliar su capacidad  y crear nuevas oportunidades abriendo nuevos mercados.  Aunque su capital es escaso encontró en la financiación un camino viable para lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Resident in a neighborhood located south west of Barranquilla, Meredis is the mother of three grown-up children, for whom she has provided for well. She was born into a family of sales people, who taught her the trade, and now, at 50 years of age, she has a long track record of selling staples, clothes and appliances. The key to her success is the dedication and commitment she brings to her business, which she undertakes from Monday to Saturday between 2pm and 7pm, offering friends and family items which are essential for their homes. 

She is applying for a Kiva loan to improve her earnings by investing in supplies such as oil, rice and other grains, as well as clothes, shoes and appliances. With 15 years of experience and a loyal clientele, she hopes that the investment will increase her sales and improve her earnings. Through her work, she expects to improve her quality of life, to expand her business and create new opportunities by opening up new markets. Although she has little capital, she found a viable way to achieve her goals through financing.

loans.use: to invest in food, oil, rice and other grains, as well as clothing, footwear and appliances.

loans.name: Tujeneza Group

texts.en:
Tujeneza is a group led by Patricie who is 27 years old. The group name means “Welcome” in English. She is married and she is pregnant. She sells foodstuffs and has been doing business for the past 6 years. 

The group members sell different items and they have the same idea for changing their lives. With the loan, she would like to buy more Irish potatoes, rice and maize flour for selling. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and make savings.

loans.use: To buy more Irish potatoes, rice and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Dairis Isabel

texts.es:
Dairis vive con sus 3 hijos en una humille casa en zona rural del municipio de La Union.
En la actualidad ya cumplió 3 años de estar trabajando con la cría de cerdos de engorde, actividad con la que ha intentado sobrevivir y sacar adelante a su familia para que nunca les falte nada. 

Ha tenido dificultades económicas que han afectado su negocio y que la han obligado a detener sus actividades en ciertas ocasiones. 

Sueña con mejorar el lugar para la cría de sus animales y también con tener una planta de engorde de cerdos, por esto pasa la solicitud de un préstamo, el cual invertirá en la compra de materiales para la adecuación y mantenimiento de sus corrales.
Su calidad de vida  y la de su familia se incrementará en la medida que aumentan las ventas de sus animales y alcance las metas establecidas para  un futuro no lejano.

Con el apoyo de este préstamo Dairis podrá continuar trabajando y podrá darle a su familia todo lo mejor.
texts.en:
Dairis lives with her three children in a humble house in a rural area of La Union. She has been raising pigs for three years now. She has used this activity to survive and provide for her family, ensuring that they never lack anything in life. 

She has had some financial problems which have affected her business, meaning that she has had to cease activity on several occasions. 

She would like to improve the area where she keeps her animals and have a special area for fattening pigs. For this reason, she is asking for a loan. She will invest the money in material for building and maintaining the space where she raises her animals. 

The quality of life for her and her family will improve as animal sales increase and she reaches her short term goals. With the support offered by this loan, she will be able to carry on working and offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to improve and maintain the area where she raises her animals.

loans.name: Duterimbere Group

texts.en:
Alice is a group leader, age 33. She is married with one child who is 4 years old.

This group is called DUTERIMBERE, which means “Vision” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses in order to change their future for the better.

Alice sells food stuffs and has been doing this business for the past 2 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas, beans, and cassava to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and improve her standards of livings.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, beans, and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Abakundanye Group

texts.en:
Soline is a group leader and 40 years old. She is married with five children aged between 3 and 16 years; they all go to school. The group is called ABAKUNDANYE, which means “The beloved one” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to make the future better. 

She sells foodstuffs and has been doing a business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, maize flour and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and make savings for the better future.

loans.use: to buy more rice, maize flour and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, brick and iron in order to contruct a sink in her house.

loans.name: Ingoboka Group

texts.en:
INGOBOKA is a group led by Marie Claire who is 38 years old. The group name means “Rapid support” in English. She is single. She sells clothes and has been doing a business for the past 11 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and make savings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Abanyamurava Group

texts.en:
ABANYAMURAVA is a group led by Grace who is 39 years old. The group name means “Active” in English. She is married with five children aged between 7 and 18 years. She sells clothes and has been doing a business for the past three years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more shirts and shorts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more shirts and shorts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of T-shirts, sweat pants, football strips, caps and shorts for her business.

loans.name: Heydi Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora  Heydi  28 años de edad  es casada y vive con sus dos hijos en su casa de habitación ubicada San Lorenzo, Valle al sur de Honduras cuenta con un negocio el cual es la elaboración y venta de alfarería, donde elabora lo que son  jarros, joyeros, gallos de barro, plato, picheles, etc.
Doña Heydi es conocida  por ser una persona luchadora con el deseo de seguir adelante está muy contenta con el apoyo que se le ha brindado, ya que con las ganancias ha mejorado su taller de alfarería. 
 Doña Heydi está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de adornos de barro como joyeros, gallos, platos, picheles, etc. ya hecho para la reventa  y con el apoyo de este préstamo la señora heydi  espera mejorar sus ingresos. 
Su sueño es  seguir mejorando su negocio y su hogar.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Mayo 2015
texts.en:
Heydi, aged 28, is married and lives with her two children in her home in San Lorenzo, in the department of Valle, located in the south of Honduras. She has a business producing and selling pottery, including jugs, jewelry boxes, clay roosters, plates, pitchers, etc. 

Heydi is known for being a fighter who wants to get ahead, and she is very happy with the support she has been given, and has used her earnings to improve her pottery workshop.

Heydi is asking for a loan to buy pottery items such as jewelry boxes, clay roosters, plates, pitchers, etc., to sell. With the help of this loan, Heydi hopes to increase her income. Her dream is to continue improving her business and her home. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2015

loans.use: to buy jewelry boxes, clay roosters, plates, pitchers, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Cancuncito Group

texts.es:
Rodeada por cerros  y sembradíos de caña se encuentra una laguna que propicia la pesca; actividad que ocupa una gran parte de habitantes de cierta comunidad veracruzana. La masa de agua y las erupciones de la tierra han dado origen a diferentes islas, la más común lleva el mote de "Cancuncito". De igual modo, desde lo alto de los cerros se puede observar un paisaje maravilloso.
    Recientemente allí se formó el grupo Cancuncito integrado por 10 personas responsables, trabajadoras, honestas y unidas. Ellos son: Bulmaro quien vende fertilizantes; Carmen y Ana, abarrotes; Epifania, Honoria, María y María L, pescado mojarra; Maricela, cosméticos; Jacobo, helados y paletas y Elena, tortillas y tamales. 
    Para Doña Epifania la vida ha sido una gran maestra puesto que ha sabido sacar provecho a su actividad económica. Ella está casada con el señor Paulino quien se ha dedicado a la pesca desde que era un niño. Doña Epi, como todos le conocen, habla 80% mazateco y 20% español, es madre de 5 hijos, todos ellos mayores de edad. Desde hace 26 años ella se dedica a vender la mojarra que su esposo pesca. Paulino se adentra a la laguna por las tardes para regresar de madrugada a casa con la pesca del día. Después, entre los dos limpian el producto.
   Doña Epi ha recorrido las calles de diferentes comunidades para vender la mojarra. Recuerda cuando tenía que caminar durante dos horas una vereda en el cerro para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes pues al principio no había acceso al transporte. “Hablo poco español, pero eso me ayuda a entender lo que me dicen mis clientes, poder cobrarles y darles cambio” comenta pues para ella el no hablar español ha sido el reto principal.
   Con las ganancias obtenidas, Epi apoya a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y el negocio. El nuevo préstamo le ayudará a invertir en la compra de hilo para telares, dos tendales de arrastre y un motor. A Epi le gustaría que su esposo y uno de sus hijos se dediquen a la cría del pescado más adelante para obtener aún más ingresos. 
El grupo agradece por la oportunidad del préstamo ya que para algunos, representa el inicio de su actividad mientra que para otros, será la manera de fortalecer la actual.

*La fotografía fue tomada frente a la laguna, Doña Epi viste blusa negra. Para poder obtener la historia fue necesaria la ayuda de Ana quien habla mazateco y español.
texts.en:
Surrounded by hills and fields of sugar cane is a lake where fishing occurs; it is the occupation of many of the inhabitants of a Veracruz community. The mass of water and land eruptions have led to the formation of different islands. The most common has the nickname "Cancuncito". Similarly, from the top of the hills you can see a wonderful scenery.

Recently, a group called Cancuncito formed there. It consists of 10 hardworking, honest and united people. The members are: Bulmaro, who sells fertilizers; Carmen and Ana, who sell groceries; Epifania, Honoria, María y María L, who sell mojarra fish (tilapia); Maricela who sells cosmetics; Jacobo who sells ice cream and popsicles, and Elena, who sells tortillas and tamales.

For Epifania, life has been a great teacher that has allowed her to take advantage of its economic activity. She is married to Paulino who has made a living fishing since he was a child. Epi, as everyone knows her, speaks Mazatec 80% of the time and knows about 20% of Spanish. She is the mother of five children, all adults. She has been selling the fish her husband catches for 26 years. Paulino enters the lake in the evening and returns home at dawn with the day's catch. Then, the two of them clean the fish.

Epi has traveled the streets of different communities to sell the tilapia. She remembers when she had to walk for two hours on a mountain trail to meet the needs of her customers, because there did not used to be transport access. "I speak some Spanish; it helps me understand what my clients tell me, to charge them, and give them change," she says. For her, not speaking Spanish has been her main challenge.
   
With her earnings, Epi supports her husband with household and business expenses. The new loan will help her invest in buying rope for weaving, two nets for drag fishing, and a motor. Epi would like her husband and one of his sons to work on rearing the fish after catching them, to make more revenue.

The group is grateful for the opportunity of the loan. For some, this represents the beginning of their business, while for others, it will serve to strengthen their current business.

* The photograph was taken in front of the lake. Epi is wearing a black blouse. To obtain this story, Ana helped, as she speaks Mazatec and Spanish.

loans.use: to buy rope for weaving, two nets for drag fishing, and a used motor.

loans.name: Tujijuke Group

texts.en:
Stephanie is a group leader and aged 24. She is married with two children aged between 2 and 4 years; they do not yet go to school. The group is called TUJIJUKE, which means “Being intellectual” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change their future for better. 

She owns a shop and has been doing a business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more salt, sugar and biscuits to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings for the better future.

loans.use: to buy more salt, sugar and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Abakoranabushake Group

texts.en:
Abakoranabushake is a group led by Groriose who is 37 years old. The group name means “Volunteers” in English. She is married with three children aged between 3 and 10 years. They all go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been doing this business for the past 7 years. 

The group members sell different items and they have the same idea for changing their lives. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum for selling. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for selling.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en: Esther is 27 years old, married and has two children, ages 7 months and 6 years. The older child goes to school. Esther leads the Abishyizehamwe Group, which means "all together” in English. The group members sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses for a better future. She sells foodstuffs and has been in business for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy Irish potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Duhozanye Group

texts.en: Duhozanye Group is led by Gerardine who is 35 years old. The group name means “help each other” in English. Gerardine is married with five children, ages 4 to 15 years. She owns a shop and has been in business for the past three years. The group members sell different items and they share the same idea for changing their lives. With the loan, Gerardine would like to buy more rice, maize flour and soap to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, maize flour and soap to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Editha

texts.en:
She hails in the town of Loon, Bohol. Her name is Ma. Editha; she is 50 years of age and a married woman with three grown children. She grows and sells pigs.  She has been engaged in hog raising business for more than five years now. 

  Ma. Editha is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and vitamins. These will improve the way she raises and sells hogs. In the few months to come, she can sell quality hogs.  This will improve her income and enable her to settle her obligation. She is determined enough to expand and manage her hog raising business successfully.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 35 years old, married and has four children, ages 1 to 10 years, with two in school. She owns a shop and has been in business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more salt, soap and lotion to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more salt, soap and lotion to sell.

loans.name: Cerenita

texts.en:
Cerenita works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Cerenita has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Cerenita has been in this business for 15 years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 34 years old with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, personal care products, school supplies, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Janice has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Janice would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, personal care products, school supplies, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 34 years old and married with two children both still in school.  Mary Grace works very hard to provide for her family.

Mary Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, and coffee.

Mary Grace has been in this business for one year.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, and coffeec

loans.name: Di-An

texts.en:
Di-an is 35 years old and married with three children who are still in school. Di-an works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, drinks and other personal care products.

Di-an has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, drinks and other personal care products.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en: Josiane is 27 years old, married and has three children, ages 2, 5 and 7 years, with one in school. She sells shoes and has been in business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 22 years old now. Josefina has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. Josefina has been in this business for two years. In the future, Josefina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 21 years old and married. She farms kale, cabbages and spinach to make a living.

In 2013 Agnes joined Kiva's field partner Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the organization’s training, especially in its enterprise development. She is borrowing 10,000 KES to buy fertilizer and certified vegetable seeds. This will increase her harvest and help her meet customer demand.

Agnes is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for its financial support. She promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and certified vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Cuna De Moisés Group

texts.es:
La comunidad mexiquense donde viven las integrantes del grupo Cuna de Moisés tiene una vista muy agradable que se aprecia apenas uno llega, lo más sobresaliente es la iglesia; complejo enorme y de color naranja. La distinguen además sus cerros repletos de enormes árboles frondosos y llenos de vida. La mayoría de los habitantes se dedica al cultivo de nopales y maíz, productos de gran valor ya que son la base de su alimentación.
   Doña Celia es una persona muy alegre y muy sociable, está casada desde hace veintisiete años con el señor Fermín. Juntos han formado una familia con seis hijos de los cuales dos de ellos aun dependen de dicha pareja y uno de ellos cursa la primaria.
   Celia tiene diez años dedicándose a la compra y venta de artículos de fantasía, inició su negocio porque quería ayudar con los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. Para Doña Celia este tipo de productos es muy fácil de vender además de que es capaz de obtener el doble de sus ganancias y le ayuda mucho el hecho de que no son artículos perecederos. "No son como los alimentos que se echan a perder y se pierden la inversión y las ganancias". A pesar de que al principio tenía muy poca mercancía poco a poco el negocio fue creciendo. Los puntos de venta de Celia son los tianguis, las plazas y mercados de la región, lugares en los que acomoda los productos tres veces a la semana. Las temporadas de lluvia son las que representan mayor dificultad para Celia ya que las ventas suelen disminuir. Con el nuevo préstamo podrá comprar bolitas, aretes, pulseras y moños para el cabello; productos indispensables en todo negocio de bisutería. "Acostumbro a comprar mucho para que me den buenos precios y así obtengo mejores ganancias".
   La meta de Celia es poder continuar con su negocio para seguir apoyando económicamente a su esposo y a la educación de su hijo, pero sobre todo mejorar su vivienda. 
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son María Isabel quien invertirá en su carpintería, Juana en productos de fantasía y Eva en su tienda de abarrotes.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de abarrotes de Doña Eva. Doña Celia es quien tiene el suéter rosa*
texts.en:
The Mexican community where the members of the group 'Cuna de Moisés' live has a wonderful view, which you see upon arriving, and whose highlight is a magnificent orange church. It also stands out because of its hills which are covered in large leafy trees and full of life.  The majority of its inhabitants work by growing prickly pears and corn, high value products that are the basis of their diet.

Doña Celia is a very sociable and cheerful person who has been married to señor Fermín for 27 years. Together they have produced a family of six children, two of which two still depend on them, with one attending elementary school. 

Celia has spent ten years working in the buying and selling of imitation jewellery.  She started her business because she wanted to help with household costs and the education of her children. For Doña Celia these types of products are very easy to sell and they also give her the opportunity to double her earnings.  It helps a lot that they are not perishable goods. "They are not like food products which go off and on which you lose your investment and income." 

Despite having only a few products at the start, little by little the business grew. Celia sells her products from street markets, squares and regional markets; places where she displays her products three times a week. The wet seasons are when Celia experiences most difficulty as her sales tend to drop. With this new loan she will be able to buy beads, earrings, bracelets and hair ribbons; indispensable products for every imitation jewellery business. "I am used to buying a lot in order to get good prices and therefore have more earnings."

Celia's goal is to be able to continue the business in order to continue supporting her husband and her child's education. Above all she wants to improve her home.

The other group members are Maria Isabel, who wants to invest in her carpentry business, Juana, in imitation goods and Eva, in her grocery business. 

*The photograph was taken in the grocery shop of Doña Eva. Doña Celia is the one wearing the pink sweater*

loans.use: to buy beads, earrings, bracelets and hair ribbons.

loans.name: Cyprien

texts.en:
Cyprien is 42 years old. He is married with 5 children aged between 2 and 14 year. 3 of them go to school. 

He owns a shop and he has been in business for the past 5 years. His wife is a business woman. With the loan, he would like to buy more salt and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a car for his business. In future, he aims to earn at least 200,000 per month

loans.use: To buy more salt and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 39 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 3 and 13 years, 3 of them go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been in business for 9 years. Her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, bananas and cassava for sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In future, she aims to earn at least 100,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more rice, bananas and cassava for sale.

loans.name: Thamar

texts.en:
Thamar is 32 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 1 and 6 years, One of them goes to school. She owns a shop and she has been in business for the past 1 year. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more toothpaste and sugar for selling. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare. In future, she wishes to earn at least 200,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more toothpaste and sugar for selling.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is aged 31 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 5 and 9 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 3 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a 42 years old woman, and mother of 3 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession and sells apples, bananas, grapes etc. Her husband is responsible to feed the entire family and manage household.

Noor's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purpose so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position her husband is not in condition to purchase fruits for his business purpose.

Therefore Noor has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca has finished repaying the previous loan. She was able to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer. This helped boost farming that increased income due to improved productivity. She was able to support her family basic needs. 

She is taking another loan to buy fertilizer and seeds that will again help expand her farming. She is grateful to Kiva for the continued support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds that will expand her farming.

loans.name: Ramon Eduardo

texts.es:
Ramon es un hombre muy trabajador y organizado, se gana la vida prestando el servicio de transporte de personas en su carro a través de las veredas del municipio de Frontino posibilitando el desplazamiento de la comunidad hasta las distintitas áreas del municipio.

Es un hombre amable, servicial y muy emprendedor, es soltero y sostiene a su madre a la cual siempre ha procurado ofrecerle la mejor vida posible.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento y reparación a su vehiculo ya que es su único medio de trabajo.

Con este crédito podrá mejorar las condiciones de su vehículo y podrá continuar prestando su servicio con total seguridad y sin poner en riesgo su vida ni la de sus clientes.

Apoya a Ramon con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Ramon is a very hardworking and organised man. He makes a living by offering his car as a transport service for people in the rural districts of the municipality of Frontino. This allows the community to move around the different areas of the municipality.

Ramon is a friendly, helpful and very enterprising man. He is single and supports his mother who has always tried to offer him the best life possible. 

Ramon is applying for a loan to service and repair his vehicle which is his only form of transport. With this loan he can improve the conditions of his vehicle and continue offering his service with complete safety without putting his life or the lives of his customers at risk.

Support Ramon with a loan today!

loans.use: to service and repair his vehicle which is his only form of transport

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is 41 years old, married and had three children who are all studying. She and her husband are farmers, planting and harvesting rice to sell. She also manages a small store for additional income. Elma wanted to improve her crop production but had insufficient funds, that is why she is now asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides needed for crop growth and maintenance. She will also use part of her loan to buy grocery items to sell in her store. Elma hopes to continue to generate good profits for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for use in her farming business.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
Hilario es un hombre de 52 años de edad, está unido con su esposa con la que tiene nueve hijos de las edades entre 7 y 29 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad denominada Hierbabuena.
Hilario con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia es comerciante desde hace 25 años, y para mejorar sus ingresos también trabaja como agricultor, gracias a estas dos actividades ha mantenido a su familia.
Hilario gracias a la amabilidad con la que atiende su tienda él cuenta con muchos clientes por tal razón tomo la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar productos como azúcar, leche, huevos, arroz y gaseosas para surtir mejor su tienda y satisfacer mejor las necesidades de la gente.
Hilario tiene el anhelo de comprar un terreno para incrementar su patrimonio y dejarles una buena herencia  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hilario is a 52 year old man who lives together with his wife with whom he has nine children between the ages of 29 and 7. His humble family live in a community named Hierbabuena.

Hilario has worked as a businessman for 25 years with the desire to obtain an income and bring up his family. To improve his earnings he also works as a farmer and thanks to these two jobs he has been able to support his family.

Due to the friendliness with which Hilario serves people in his store he has a lot of customers. Because of this he made the decision to apply for a loan to buy groceries such as sugar, milk, eggs, rice and soft drink to better stock his store and satisfy his customers' needs.

Hilario yearns to buy a plot of land to improve his legacy and leave his children a good inheritance.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as sugar, milk, eggs, rice and soft drink

loans.name: Mushtri

texts.en:
Mushtri is a 51 years-old-woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and is a responsible mother of 6 children. Her son is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly because of which her son is unable to generate any amount of income. 

Her son wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to a lack of money her son finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore Mushtri has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son to cover the cost of the repairs. This will help him to continue his business. Mushtri is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC  Pakistan.

loans.use: assist her son in repairing his rickshaw

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret used the previous loan to buy textile fabric that helped boost her tailoring business.This led to more income that helped provide family needs such as food and education to her children. She is borrowing a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds. This will enable her increase income thus meet the demand for maize and beans thus improving her business and be in a position to educate her children.
Margaret is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the continued support.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds. This will makle an increase in her income, so meeting the demands  for maize and beans .

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is aged 25 years. She is married with 2 children aged between 1 and 3 years, who are too young for school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 7 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare and to pay school fees in the future for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which she used to buy additional Vita Plus products to sell. Her earnings from direct-selling helped support her family and meet their daily basic needs

Julie is now requesting another 50,000 PHP loan to buy more natural food supplements and multivitamins (Vita Plus Products) to meet the increasing demand for her items. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and for the financial assistance that will be given to her.  The loan will surely help cover her family’s everyday personal and household needs.

In the future, Julie dreams to open branches in other areas. She desires to help her less-privileged relatives and to live a victorious life. Julie faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy food supplements and vitamins (Vita Plus Products) needed in her business

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is aged 38 years. She is married with 4 children aged between 3 and 11 years. 2 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 16 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and pay school fees of her children and to buy a goat for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 36 years-old-woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 2 children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past 20 years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. 

Farzana's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all above these products for reselling purpose. Therefore Farzana has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 
Farzana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase stock in her husband's general store business

loans.name: Jeannete

texts.en:
Jeannete is aged 38 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 8 and 14 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 8 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and pay the school fees of her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.
