loans.name: Benoit

texts.en:
Benoit is 34 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 1 and 6 years, one of them goes to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 8 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Las Mariposas Group

texts.es:
Cerca de las vías por las que transita el tren conocido como “La Bestia” se encuentra ubicada una comunidad oaxaqueña de donde es originario el grupo llamado Las Mariposas. El nombre se debe al gusto que las integrantes comparten por la libertad y la belleza de estos pequeños seres. Cabe hacer mención que “La Bestia” se utiliza como servicio de carga, trasportando grano o azúcar pues la zona es totalmente productora de caña.
   Los integrantes del grupo y sus actividades son: Rafaela quien vende cerdos; Noemí, abarrotes; Cintia, recipientes de plástico; Ana Bertha, mojarra; Mario, refacciones de motocicletas; Nancy, calzado por catálogo y tortillas hechas a mano y Alicia, joyería. Por su lado, Salvador maneja un restaurante y Abel realiza decoraciones. 
   El mayor sueño de Mario siempre había sido tener su propio negocio y no depender de nadie; para poder lograrlo trabajó arduamente. Vendía tortillas de lunes a domingo desde las 5 de la mañana y hasta las 2 de la tarde, así, con las ganancias obtenidas y los préstamos otorgados, pudo iniciar con la venta de refacciones para motocicleta. Al inicio vendía en casa y cuando él no estaba su esposa atendía a los clientes, exhibía la mercancía en una pequeña vitrina y colgaba las llantas en un tubo colocado en el techo del corredor de su casa.
   Hace cuatro meses Mario abrió su propia refaccionaria en la calle principal del municipio. Su clientela aumentó gracias a los precios accesibles y a su amplio surtido, su lema es “al cliente lo que pida, si no lo tengo lo consigo y a mejor precio”. Con las ganancias obtenidas solventa los gastos de su hogar, cubre los pagos de la renta y aumenta la variedad de accesorios para satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes.
   Mario espera lograr una estabilidad en su actividad para después abrir una segunda refaccionaria la cual será atendida por Maricela, su esposa. Esta vez el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de espejos, baleros, balatas, aceite, bujías y cámaras para los neumáticos.

*La fotografía fue tomada frente a las vías por donde “La Bestia” hace su recorrido, Mario viste playera blanca y una gorra. La niña que viste short blanco es hija de doña Rafaela que viste pantalón blanco. La niña de short a cuadros es hija de doña Noemí quien viste blusa verde.
texts.en:
Close to the tracks where the train known as the 'The Beast' passes you can find a oaxaquena community which is home to a group called Las Mariposas (The Butterflies). This name comes from the members' shared love of the freedom and beauty of these little creatures. It should be mentioned that 'The Beast' is used as a cargo service to transport grain or sugar as the area produces only sugar cane.

The group members and their jobs are: Rafaela, who sells pigs; Noemí, groceries; Cintia, plastic containers; Ana Bertha, knives; Mario, motorbike parts; Nancy, footwear from a catalogue and homemade tortillas and Alicia, jewellery. For his part Salvador manages a restaurant and Abel makes decorations. 

Mario's greatest wish has always been to have his own store and not depend on anyone; to achieve this he has worked arduously. He sold tortillas from Monday to Sunday from 5 in the morning until 2 in the afternoon and with the earnings he made and the loans he was granted he was able to begin selling motorbike parts. At the beginning he sold them from home and when he wasn't in his wife served the customers. He displayed his merchandise in a small glass cabinet and hung the tyres from a pipe on the ceiling of the corridor in his house.

Four months ago Mario opened his own repair store in the main street of the municipality. His clientele has expanded thanks to his accessible prices and his wide range of stock. His motto is "if the client asks for it, they get it; if I don't have it I will get it and at a better price". With the income he has made he can pay the household bills, cover the rent and increase his variety of accessories to satisfy his customers' tastes. 
 
Mario hopes to achieve financial stability with this job so that he can open a second repairs store where Maricela, his wife, will work. This loan will be used to buy mirrors, ball bearings, brake pads, oil, spark plugs and tyre chambers. 

*This photo was taken in front of the train tracks where 'The Beast' runs. Mario is wearing a white t-shirt and a cap.  The girl who is wearing white shorts is the daughter of Rafaela who is wearing white pants. The girl in the checked shorts is the daughter of Noemí who is wearing a green blouse.

loans.use: to buy mirrors, ball bearings, brake pads, oil, spark plugs and tyre chambers

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from training on enterprise management and financial management. She is 41 years old, married, and a mother of four children.

She practices vegetable and dairy farming. Jacinta is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and dairy feed to increase her farm's production of milk and vegetables. This will increase her income to enable her meet her family's basic needs with ease.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and dairy cow feeds to increase production of milk and vegetables, hence earning more income to pay for the family's expenses.

loans.name: Mutirithia Women Group

texts.en:
The woman raising her hand is Mary, who is 64 years old and a mother of three children. Susan and she make up the Mutirithia Women Group. In 2013 Mary joined Kiva's field partner Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to benefit from its training, especially in enterprise development.

Mary sells water and charcoal to earn a living. She has applied for a 40,000 KES loan to be divided between the two women. She plans to use her portion to buy more charcoal to add to her stock so she can meet all of her customers’ orders. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to add to her stock

loans.name: Lorenso

texts.es:
Lorenso es un hombre de 42 años de edad, trabajador, entusiasta, sonriente que se dedica a la venta de pulpas de frutas y hielo  los cuales distribuye en su hogar y también sale a vender montado en una bicicleta con una nevera hecha en icopor que es portable, vive solo no tiene pareja ni hijos, lo que producto apenas le alcanza para pagar sus cuentas comunes y esto es lo que lo tiene preocupado pues decidió montar un negocio para generar más ingresos que le permitieran incrementar su calidad de vida que es su objetivo principal pues una vez esté más estable, pensara en comprar casa propia, carro, viajar en ese respectivo orden o por lo menos eso tiene pensando.
La competencia en el sector, con las tiendas, personas naturales ha rebajo sus ventas, por ello quiere realizar una inversión para recuperar clientes, ofreciéndoles mayor variedad de frutas y buenos precios.

Lorenso quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de frutas, plásticos y mejoramiento de las bicicletas, este último le permitirá cargar dos neveras, aumentando sus existencias, ahorrando tiempo en entregas y pudiendo llegar a más personas sin necesidad de volver a su casa a reabastecerse.
texts.en:
Lorenso is 42 years old, hard working, enthusiastic, and always smiling.  He sells fruit pulps and ice from his house.  He also sells his poducts by riding around in his bike with an attached portable cooler.  
He lives by himself and has no partner nor children.  His income is barely enough to cover his basic expenses and that keeps him worried because he opened the store with the goal of improving his quality of life.  Once he's more stable he would like to buy a house, a car, and travel, in that order.  
The competition in the area with other stores has decreased his sales which is why he wants to invest now to recuperate some clients by offering a greater variety of fruits and good prices.   Lorenso is requesting a loan to buy more fruits, plastics, and to make improvements to his bicycle.  The latter will allow him to carry two coolers, increasing his stock, and saving time with his deliveries by being able to reach more people without having to go back home to restock.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, plastics, and to make improvements to his bicycle

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
50-year-old Wilma is a resident of Carmona, Cavite. She has worked as sewer in a garment factory located in GMA, Cavite for 15 years now. Her job includes edging, sewing and maintenance of sewing machines. She’s married to Apolinario, a driver, and they have three children. 

Wilma’s minimum wage combined with her husband’s irregular income as driver cannot usually suffice their growing financial needs. Their usual problem is how to make ends meet, because aside from basic needs such as food and utilities, they are paying for house rental. Moreover, they are burdened with their children’s education. When it’s time for enrollment, they look for a reasonable loan and financial assistance, but they are being lured by usurious lending agencies with very high interest rates. The couple, specially Wilma, is trying to avoid these loan sharks knowing that these usurious agencies will require her to surrender her ATM card as loan collateral. It is a blessing that she became a member of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*, where she found another option. It is her prayer that you can help her provide for her children’s tuition and avoid the lure of usurious money lenders. 

For Filipino families like Wilma’s, education is the most valued inheritance that they can give to their children. She trusts the Lord that their children will finish education through your kind help. Wilma is also praying to own a house for the whole family someday.

Wilma meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work. 

*The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for employment. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services. 

**CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before they start their daily work routines. Bible readings, prayer devotions, and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for her children's tuition

loans.name: Yolmi Lorena

texts.es:
Yolmy es una bella mujer de 20 años de edad, soltera, criada con unas muy buenas costumbres, desde el colegio desarrollo una gran pasión y gusto por todo lo relacionado con la belleza.  

Inicio su etapa productiva realizando cursos y capacitaciones, hasta que un día se aventuró y decidió ir en busca de su propia clientela montando un negocio de salón de belleza y relajación en su hogar. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de equipo electrocurador, alta frecuencia, vaporizador, faja térmica y surtido pues también quiere vender productos para complementar sus servicios, como crema de manos, gel, productos capilares, tinturas para cabello, barnices.

El crédito para ella será muy importante pues terminara de consolidar su empresa completándola con todos los insumos necesarios para operar y ofrecer cualquier servicio que lleguen a solicitarle.

Su sueño es que su empresa progrese de la mano de Interactuar y tenga muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Yolmy is a beautiful 20 year old woman.  She is single and was raised with some very good customs.  Since junior high she has developed a great passion and joy for all things related to beauty.  

She began her work by taking courses and training, until one day she decided to take a chance and go looking for her own customers, starting a beauty and relaxation salon in her home.  

She is asking for a loan in order to purchase equipment such as a high frequency electric dryer, a vaporizer, thermal bandages, and a variety of products to sell in order to complement her services, such as hand creme, gel, hair products, hair dye and and nail polish.  

This loan is very important for Yolmy because it will allow her to consolidate her business with all the necessary items in order to operate and offer any services that her clients request.  

Her dream is that her business will grow and she will have many customers.

loans.use: to purchase equipment such as a high frequency electric dryer, a vaporizer, thermal bandages, and a variety of product to sell in order to complement her services, such as hand creme, gel, hair products, hair dye and and nail polish.
